Reviews.Title: “Repeat visit = repeat liking for this place!”
Reviews.Author: BorderRambler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again a year after first staying here (see my first review for details). This time we were in the main building where you check in. The rooms were of exactly the same spec and standard as I had known from my previous stay in one of their adjacent buildings. The condition of the place and courtesy of the staff was also top notch like last time... My only gripe is that it is pricey, but you do get what you pay for in this instance.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with A class service”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for busines in January. This is a amazing hotel with amazing service and amenities. Service: The service here was impeccable. Check in was a a simple process where I was literally treated like I owned the hotel. I was staying in the Gold which has it's own concierge and access to a private lounge. The attendant was very helpful and polite and remembered my name from the start. They must speak with the front desk or something because he addressed me by my name which I never told him minutes after being in the main lobby.. guess it's possible there were not many other guests but I don't think so. Room: You can't beat these rooms. If you want five start amenities this is in. The room is huge for a king size room with a long entrance, huge closet, desk leather eco chair and very stylish furnishings. The bed very extremely comfy and I never wanted to get up for work. The bathroom was very well layer out with a huge shower and separate toilet area. The toiletries where top notch and all wonderful. I liked the fully stocked mini bar and snacks as I sometimes like a drink in the room or snack before bed. tsk tsp right.. Oh! and please don't be alarmed when you get to your room and the lights are dimmed and the music is playing.. there is no one in the room I swear. It's just the turn down service.. But the Music was so loud I felt bad for the neighbors. Spaces: I used the lounge for work and play. My manager and myself would go to the horderves after we finished working and before dinner. The food was amazing with cheese and salmi and many other items that changes every day including hot sandwiches and sliders one day. They coffee is Nestle and Illy which were both amazing. There is off course a full service honor bar which had tons of options. If you do not know how to make a drink they attendant did offer to help. We also had breakfast in the lounge every morning which was again very tasty. hey had fresh juice which was to die for. Near by: We at at Bricco one night which was to die for. I would highly recommend this restaurant if you are in the area. I had a seafood risotto which was amazing and fresh. We also at at a sushi place but the name escapes me right now. But the Sushi was amazing and I am a huge sushi fan. Overall: I would highly recommend this hotel for it's service and small touches that make you feel like your at home. PS. Enjoy a nice drink in front of the fire places in the lounge it is very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: T S
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to go back to the Fairmont Batter Wharf! Having stayed at numerous hotels during sorority conferences, I have had a range of experiences, but I can attest to the quality service that I was given. The staff was extremely courteous, they bent over backwards to ensure that my stay was pleasant. The rooms were absolutely amazing! Had I not had a meetings, I would definitely have stayed in bed all day! Anyone looking for comfort, great service, and warm, friendly hosts, please make sure you make your way to the Fairmont Battery Wharf!

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: MattBart3975
Reviews.Content: I was personally walked to my room by the check in clerk - a first for me. Room is a decent size for Boston and included a 42" LCD TV with true HD service and satellite radio. Even had a repeater speaker in the bathroom! Dinner at the hotel was delicious and was a good value with the 50% off coupon I was given at the front desk. I got back from dinner and turndown service had lowered the lights, changed the towels, and put on jazz music on the satellite radio. Bed was amazingly comfortable. If people were staying in the rooms next to me I had no idea thanks to the great insulation between the rooms. Lots of little extras like a phone that looked like a computer, an espresso machine, old school coffee peculator, automatic lights in the closet, and a nice sound system and media player hooked up to the TV. I had the cheapest available room and still had a halfway decent view of the water. Room felt very secure thanks to card-key-only access to the building and the elevators. My only complaint was that the valet staff drove guests' cars a little hard (OK that's an understatement, he was beating the snot out of them) but when I brought it to the attention of the hotel manager he assured me it would be taken care of. Absolutely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bee R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. I stayed here in the Fall for my sorority's conference and it was just a beautiful hotel and a good price for the luxury.

Reviews.Title: “One of the bests!”
Reviews.Author: petarandreev
Reviews.Content: We love, love, love this wonderful hotel. If you want to be treated like a special guest from the moment you arrive, with lovely details like slippers and soft fluffy robes on your bed, music playing softly when you come into your room, beautiful furnishings , incredibly friendly and attentive service from everyone in the hotel, then this is the place for you to stay. It always exceeds our expectations when we stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Liam2424
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The service was great we pull up they take our stuff out of the car and parked the car. We checked in and then they took us up to our room. The room was beautiful. The decorations were nice and the room was clean. We had a great stay, the service was good and everyone was nice. This is typically a business hotel but I went for leisure and it worked. You should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: jacey123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one evening at this hotel after purchasing a discount coupon. The hotel was beautiful, very clean and had great views of the harbor. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was great. We walked to the North End for dinner, so the location was so convenient for us. We would definitely stay here again. We did find cheaper parking in an adjacent lot, opting out of the valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “A winter weekend in Beantown”
Reviews.Author: Doccatch
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive at Battery Wharf, you will be amazed at the level of service offered to you. The staff ANTICIPATES most every need and responds in kind. You won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel very modern.”
Reviews.Author: Mattypats
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here thoroughly. Very friendly hotel staff and excellent location on the water.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel For Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: WindsNWaters
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston in May 2008 for a long weekend duringt he Volvo Ocean race stop over. The room was impeccable, the service was five star, and we were even upgraded to a Junior Suite. Would go again

Reviews.Title: “Best in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Engenius_izmir
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best hotels I've ever stayed. Central, quiet and accommodating. You barely can see anyone else in the hotel which makes you think you are the only person staying.

Reviews.Title: “"Great room but . . .”
Reviews.Author: Nardiesally
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for business. I got the room on Hotwire. I paid $169. The hotel is beautiful and the room was perfect. No complaints about the room. The staff was very nice. My only complaint about the property is that it is a 2-story 150 room property. My room was on the second floor with a view of the harbor. Unfortunately, when I opened the window, I looked directly into a "yacht" where the owner was having breakfast. No privacy. I had to keep my shades closed for most of the time. Also, the only way to get from the Hotel to the Spa is a brief walk outside. Not a problem, except when it is 8 degrees out and you are wearing shorts. The work-out facility was very good. The location of the hotel was well situated for the North End, but not anywhere near where I needed to be. It is essentially in a mixed use residential section of town. A pretty easy and short walk to the North end but, on a cold dark winter night, not the most pleasant walk in the city.

Reviews.Title: “On the water, near little Italy, impersonal but somehow posh”
Reviews.Author: Birotteau
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel with some subtle conveniences. Great phone, good and large screen. Excellent comfortable shower. WC is in a separate compartment, opaque glass door has a big gap at the bottom. Superb bed. Walking distance to many restaurants, museums, attractions, interesting sights. Valet parking is woefully expensive, at $42 per day, and probably more expensive than the rental! Rooms on the ground floor have views on the corridor around the hotel, so you share your windows with the passers-by. Other Fairmonts (Beijing for modern, Banff for classical) are nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaFenwayI30
Reviews.Content: I love staying here whenever i come on business. I stay almost once a month and they are great there. The rooms are very nice and new, the service and check-in is a breeze, and the old fashioned cocktails in the lounge are the best. Plus it is walking distance to all the wonderful north end restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: manzie16
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel- it is in a perfect location, right near the north end. The rooms were clean & spacious. The staff was FABULOUS! Also the shower was has hot water!!! The beds were super comfortable and the view of the harbor was fantastic. My husband & I are looking forward to staying there again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific New Years Eve Wedding”
Reviews.Author: G M
Reviews.Content: We were married at the Fairmont Battery Wharf on New Year's Eve. We couldn't have been happier with the service we received, starting with our very first meeting through to the event itself. Ashley Lamy and her team took care of every need we had throughout the process and ensured that our big night went off without a hitch. The venue proved to be the perfect setting for the wedding and all of our guests raved about the quality and quantity of food. We would highly recommend the Fairmont Battery Wharf to anyone considering a Boston wedding! Gina and Gerry

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in Boston (Sorry Long Wharf!)”
Reviews.Author: Nancy G
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I recently stayed at the Fairmont Battery Wharf for a last minute getaway to celebrate my husband's birthday in the city. We got an amazing rate through Priceline. It has been my experience that when you get such a great deal on price the experience is not always the best but that was certainly not the case at this hotel. Upon arrival we were greeted by a wonderful staff. The valet, the bellhop and the front desk were all so professional and welcoming. The check-in process was flawless. The man checking us in (Ricky?) was friendly, upbeat, engaging and helpful. When I was greeted with his upbeat demeanor I told him I was so glad to be there, and to have such a nice reception, as my day was not going so well. A normal response from any other hotel would be, "I am sorry to hear that." But instead he asked, "Why? What happened?" And I found myself telling him! That is how welcome he made me feel. He then offered my husband and me a drink at the hotel restaurant on the house. Seriously, Can't remember when I have had such a lovely check in. When we got to our beautiful room (that was located in the main building) there was a pastry box, filled with specialty biscotti from a North End bakery, waiting for my husband with a personalized birthday note from the hotel. My daughter was thrilled! The decor of our room was stylish and modern and we had a very nice view. Everything was immaculate and the bathtub looked very inviting (I am not one to use the hotel bathtub but this one was immaculate). The location cannot be beat and have I told you how amazing the staff is? The one down side is that there is no pool so my daughter was a bit disappointed. We loved walking around the harbor and being so close to the historic North End. This was our second stay at the Fairmont Battery Wharf and will not be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Never Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: LovestoTravelDianeMc
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Battery Wharf was wonderful! Location: perfect. 5 minute walk to the countless Italian restaurants in the North End of Boston (very nice neighborhood - feel safe walking around all hours of the night). 10 minute walk to Faneuill Hall/Quincy Market/Freedom Trail and other main historical attractions. 15 minute walk to TD Garden where the Bruins/Celtics play. $6 taxi ride to other area attractions. Staff: young, attractive and very helpful! They were very willing to help us with area restaurants and the touring plans. Housekeeping does a nice turndown service too (replaces towels, turns down the blankets, fills the ice chest, and sets the music low for a relaxing return from a day of touring). Rooms: modern and contemporary. Most Fairmonts have a traditional or Victorian-ish theme, but not the Battery Wharf. Leather bed frames, contempory art, super comfortable mattresses, modern fixtures, huge flat screen and sci-fi touchscreen telephone that gives you the weather and other tips. Room is a bit small but met our needs perfectly. We loved our room. Restaurant at Hotel: seemed crowded each night but we didn't stop in. Cost: Fairmonts are usually a bit expensive but generally worth the extra cost. Battery Wharf is no different. 150 rooms with partial water views. Hotel is on the first two floors of the building while high-end residences take up the top 6 floors. Negatives: rooms in the basic category are a bit small and the closet is very tiny. Single biggest ATROCITY was that overnight valet parking is $42 per day! This is simply ridiculous. We considered renting a car due to the cold weather this time of year. Fortunately, we checked the website, saw the fee and did not rent a car. Overall rating: great...we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Polite service but I don't understand people's awe of this place?!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyVacationersMa
Reviews.Content: As I sit here writing this I am still puzzled about this property. I am wondering whether I am not sophisticated enough to appreciate it's allure? I'll try my best to explain: Despite having to wait a half hour+ to check into our room, the staff was very polite though they should have offered us free breakfast for the inconvenience. (Check in time is 3. We arrived at 3:15 and the room wasn't ready until 3:50). We were not wowed, at all, with the atmosphere of the lobby. It felt very cold and corporate. The hotel has rooms in different buildings and feels disconnected. It reminded me of being on a business trip and staying in a business owned, tiny condo. Our room was small, impersonal, and although the hotel is fairly new, it still felt worn. We got to the room to discover there was no bath tub - a huge disappointment for me. When we asked the front desk we were told that most rooms do not have tubs and it would have been an extra $300 to get a suite which had one!! Also the room was really small. I know we were in a city but it still felt unusually cramped. The rooms did have robes but they were thin, scratchy and unappealing. The best part of the hotel was the bedding. The sheets had lots of threads and the mattress and pillows were yummy. In summary from the reviews I read I was expecting something like the W in NYC...no such luck.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes your better off going for an old fashioned hotel.”
Reviews.Author: morr87
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Fairmont Copley I decided to give this new modern Fairmont a chance. I have only ever stayed at Fairmonts older properties in Canada and the States, so I thought id get a more modern version of there signature style and service. I was very much mistaken. Guess this proves that new does not mean better. Yes superficially this is ultra sleek and new hotel looks promising but as soon as I made my way to check-in the bubble burst. I came in the morning and being booked into the gold floor I asked the bellman where to go, the answer the checkin desk, after queuing for 15 minutes with luggage in hand I was told that the gold floor was a separate building. Without even an offer to help transfer my bags I was told to proceed diagonally across the square to check in there. Upon arriving (still with luggage) there door would not open, and there wasn't even so much as a 'ring for assistance' button or phone. Not starting out so well. After finally receiving help from a very nice receptionist I finally made it to my room. The rest of the stay was uneventful. The building and rooms were nice with a very residential feel to them. Modern decor and amenities, especially compared to the Fairmont I know. Despite the young age and look to the hotel everything seemed to be well worn, wall paper scratched and paint that was chipping away covered up with paint (though not quite the same colour.) There restaurant onsite is a real treat. Italian food meets boston american, chowder and truffle pasta on the same menu. It was very nice and service was A1, for North America. Sat at the chefs counter (bar style seating on the hotplate, so you can observe the chefs team preparing orders). There executive chef was even so nice as to show me the way (personally) to the toilets. Only slight criticism maybe is that there portions were HUGE. Checkout had to have been the strangest I ever experienced. I presented my self downstairs and couldn't find a soul in sight. Finally when I saw what appeared to be a staff member (wearing a sweatshirt) I asked if I could check out, she said its all been sorted and told me to go across to catch a taxi, if I needed it. From check in to check out the hotel seems to be (besides the restaurant) run by staff that have no idea what customer service is supposed to be in a 5 star hotel, certainly not what I expect from Fairmont. I think I'll stick to there older properties with staff that know how to properly treat guests.

Reviews.Title: “Understated luxury on the north end of Boston Harbor”
Reviews.Author: SpecialK01030
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night between Christmas and New Year as a quick getaway. Very friendly staff; we were greeted immediately by the valet attendant and bellman as soon as we opened the car doors. Check in was quick and courteous, with the desk staff offering area maps and recommendations for dinner in the North End. We'd pre-purchased a king deluxe harborview room at a discounted rate, and I was pleased that we were still treated warmly on check-in. This is a multi-building low rise property at the northern end of the harbor. Building 3 contains the lobby, restaurant and guest rooms; we had room 3136 which did indeed have a lovely view of the harbor looking south. (The first digit of the room numbers indicates the building, with the 3 remaining digits being the room number.) This room is close to the end of the building and as such was very quiet. Room decor was modern/Asian, with muted colors and expansive wood. Very comfortable pillow-top king bed with duvet and extra pillows. Small writing desk with wired internet also had excellent wireless signal. Join the Fairmont Presidents Club (it's free) to get free Internet service - unusual for the downtown luxury hotels. Very large wall mounted flat screen TV had a superb picture and an astounding number of channels, many in HD, from Dish Network (first time I've ever had Al Jazeera in a US hotel.) Nespesso coffee maker looked interesting but with the North End next door, went unused. The room was large and comfortable, with a leather recliner by the window - good for gazing at the harbor ferries. Bath was spacious but take note: rainforest shower (along with a standard showerhead) only - no bathtub. Towels were surprisingly average; not large and fluffy as I'd expected from an otherwise well-appointed room. And towel racks were located under the sink, which required bending down to grab hand and bath towels - might have been in an accessible room, but had no indication of it. Sink was one of those Kohler trendy flat basins that look great dry, but add water and a serious flood ensues, no matter how cautious one tries to be. One cool feature: the closet is accessible from inside the bathroom as well as the room's entrance. We did not use the bathrobes, but they did look presidential. The entire room was spotlessly clean.They did turndown service while we were out for dinner, which we didn't expect, but was a nice touch. The North End is a 2 minute walk and there are dozens of great places for dinner on Hanover St, Salem St and the many side streets. Peek in the windows to check the atmosphere (and potential wait), read the menu posted outside and pick your favorite, It's hard to go wrong. We ate at Rabia's on Salem, where we'd had nice meals on previous getaways, and had lovely meals in a quiet atmosphere. We did decide to have an expensive hotel breakfast at Aragosta, the hotel restaurant, and were blown away by the food. Yeah, it was expensive ($9-15 entrees), but was quite possibly the best breakfast out I've ever had. The service was also excellent, with the hotel manager supplementing the waitstaff without needing to (the two of us and a family of 6 were the only guests.) They offer healthy options (gluten-free, low carb, raw food) as well as standard fare. We enjoyed Bircher Muesli with sliced apple and banana, and crepes with scrambled eggs, chives, greyere cheese and creme fraiche. And excellent coffee too. Fabulous! Other things of note: We received a $25 coupon for spa treatments at check-in, but sadly, did not use it. We did visit the "Maritime Museum" located at ground level in the building directly across from the restaurant. The photos and description of the history of Battery Wharf and the vicinity are nicely presented, very interesting and worth 10-15 minutes to read. If it's 4 degrees like it is now, use the underground passageways linking the buildings to get there. Good points: harbor location close to North End, warm, efficient service, large rooms, comfortable beds, great view of Boston Harbor, excellent restaurant, good winter value compared with the other Boston Harbor hotels. Not so good: Valet parking is $42 and they ask for 30 minutes' notice to retrieve your car (ours was ready in 10 minutes but it was very quiet at the hotel.) Very few cheap breakfast options nearby on weekdays. First floor rooms are less private than upper floors as the Harborwalk runs all the way around the hotel (joggers, walkers etc. although during winter it's less of a concern.) If you want to keep the curtains open, don't take the first floor. The not so good points, however, were minor. We loved this hotel - the room, service and location exceeded our expectations. I liked this hotel much more than other downtown hotels, most of which have higher rates (including expensive valet parking) and less comfortable rooms. We hope to be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: merboston
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for NYE. Checked into the hotel and had to go outside to a different building to get to our room. There was no soap/shampoo/conditioner in the shower. Had to call the front desk twice. Finally housekeeping arrived with shampoo and conditioner only (no soap). Even though it did not seem like there were a lot of rooms on our floor, we heard constant banging doors all night. Upon check-out I questioned them multiple times on our room service charges - 2 breakfasts cost $110 (for a $25 and $23 breakfast). After the third time arguing with them they realized the waiter had put our room number (#5003) as the tip! Then it took almost 45 minutes for the valet to pull the car up. All in all, not a great experience

Reviews.Title: “Great staff/location, beautiful rooms, but thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: lindsaypindsay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights just before New Year's Eve and overall we loved our stay. The rooms are beautiful and elegant, and stood up to the standard of a Fairmont (I've stayed in many Fairmonts before). The only issue we had with the rooms was that the walls are quite thin and you can hear almost everything going on in the hallway (including loud conversations before 7am....). Also, any doors slamming in the hall can be heard too. The staff were very friendly. When their marketing manager saw on Twitter that I was staying there and looking forward to sampling some 'chowdah', she sent a personalised card and map, noting the four best restaurants for chowder. Really nice touch. The staff at the front desk were quick and efficient, and happy to chat about restaurant questions I had, and to find out how our days went and what we got up to. As I said, overall, it was fantastic, except for the thin walls. Despite that, I'd still recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel Near the North End”
Reviews.Author: NDGirlInCali
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly new and quite modern compared to most of the other hotels in Boston and divided in to several buildings. It is located in the North End just a short distance from quaint cobblestone streets and fantastic Italian restaurants. Quincy Market is also a short walk away and do-able even in the bitter cold! The check-in and other services were fine although we are pretty low maintenance and pretty much just check-in and check-out. My husband and I stayed in a standard room and since I had to work, made use of the nice desk and high-speed internet. While I have read that people would rather have a coffee machine rather than an espresso machine, you can just use the "espresso" pack and select the larger cup size for a "coffee" instead of an espresso. The room layout (especially the bathroom) is quite clever. The toilet is ensconced in opaque glass next to the shower. The doors to both have towel racks maximizing space. The closets in the hallway also open up in the bathroom which is pretty clever. Also, antiquated phone in toilet (weird!) and TV speaker in bathroom which would be nice for business travelers. The lighting in the bathroom is FANTASTIC! A few gripes. The relative lack of privacy of the bathroom. This is a personal preference but I have noticed that many modern hotels use sliding doors for the bathroom (W in Time Square NYC and AVIA in Napa Valley) which I am not a fan of. Also, no tub in the standard room. While parking fees are standard in any major urban hotel it still irritates me. You have to build in an extra $42 per day cost to the hotel. If we were just staying in Boston we would not rent a car but we were traveling all over New England and had to valet. The gym, located in the hotel's spa, is pretty decent by hotel standards and have treadmills (with TV), bikes, free weights, Swiss ball, Kettle Balls, and a few weight machines. The treadmills were on pads to minimize noise and vibration but resulted in wobbliness. I couldn't even run on one for fear of twisting an ankle. But it was nice looking out the window down on to the street.

Reviews.Title: “New Years 2012”
Reviews.Author: SLBuckley
Reviews.Content: The property was lovely as usual, our check in was a bit delayed, however, while we waited at bar, the "HOUSE" covered our first round. The only bad piece, was that we were placed into a connecting room- with a wedding party. not just people in the wedding- the PARTY.... very loud. The kid checking us in maybe, should have thought of that..... however, at 3 AM when I called the Desk, Mark(?) moved us in minutes, so, problem solved. The bartender, Ned- went above and beyond in all things, food recommendations, drinks, chat. While our room was delayed- AFTER his shift was over, he still went to try and find out what was the delay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, fails as a Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: mfhphotography
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the FBW to celebrate New Years Eve. Great location: North End, excellent restaurants, business district, historical sites and Back Bay shopping. I have stayed in 3 other Fairmont hotels and I wanted quality service and staff, and a luxurious room. Before going to Boston, I went to Maine to do work on my 77 year old mother's house for a week. I therefore brought my older pickup truck. When I arrived at the Fairmont, the valet repeatedly asked me to use a local parking garage instead of using the hotel's valet service. On my insistence, the valet finally agreed to do his job. The rooms were so poorly constructed that anytime a guest closed their door, the walls shook, which also vibrated our door. This occurred throughout the night. There is very poor insulation between rooms, so I had the pleasure of listening to all that entails, including the apparent chest cold of the woman next door. (I went for NY eve celebrations, so I was not looking for silence, often returning to the room sometime after 2 a.m.) I brought the valet and noise issues to the attention of the front desk who replied, "Yes, we have gotten a lot of those complaints." I have stayed in cheap motels that left the light on for me which had better staff. I cannot recommend this Fairmont to anybody. The hotel also only has one dining option. Major disappointment. Despite the above, the hospitality staff was very good; the room design (not construction) was very elegant with big bathrooms and modern features.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: FromNH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from an overnight getaway in Boston and stayed at the Fairmont. It could not have been better. The check-in process was very quick, the staff offered to let us switch rooms if we weren't satisfied with our rooms (we were very satisfied, lovely view of the harbor, spotlessly clean), and offered to help us with any needs. It is a quick walk up to the North End restaurants and less than 10 minutes to the T. The location is pretty quiet, away from the bustle and tourists. The coffee in the room was the strong and fresh. The room was well-stocked, nice robes, good magnifying mirror, lovely soaps, very comfortable bed and pillows. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Will be Back!”
Reviews.Author: TrixieTree
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a getaway weekend in Boston, electing to stay at the FA Battery Wharf, primarily for the location. It is located in the North End, famous for it's hundred's of Italian Restaurants. THE place to be any night of the week. The hotel was gorgeous, service was fantastic, my only complaint was the cost of parking, usd42/day!

Reviews.Title: “I wish I would have spent more time in my room.”
Reviews.Author: Dalailali
Reviews.Content: Hotel is newly built, for Boston standards, at least. Hotel is in a great location yet away from all the hustle and bustle of the city. If you are lucky enough to get a room with a Harbour view, the serenity is spectacular. I wish I would have ben able to spend more time there. The mattress quality was excellent. The size of the bathroom rather large. The hotel is split in to two buildings. Try and stay in the building where the lobby and the restaurants are. If you can't, it wouldn't be the end of the world. Breakfast in the outdoor patio is a great way to start the morning, except in winter!

Reviews.Title: “Glad I took another chance”
Reviews.Author: houseelfdobby
Reviews.Content: After speaking with management I decided to stay at the Battery Wharf for my Thanksgiving visit to see if I could fall in love with this hotel again. I did! Service was so much better this visit. Some things could use a freshing up (bed linens, throws, towels) but still a wonderful place to stay. Exhale spa-awesome. Hotel restaurant-great food and very friendly service. Headed back to Boston in June and will make Battery Wharf my home again......Laurie at the front desk is just a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Entertainment and a GREAT Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: NY_ShoeGirl
Reviews.Content: I LOVED my stay at the Fairmont Battery Wharf! The view from the room was amazing overlooking the water. So peaceful and serene. The bed was very firm but, not hard. I prefer the Westin and Four Season's beds. :) The TV was great with excellent choices in movies and entertainment. I liked that I could see my portfolio online. The mini-bar was stocked with top shelf liquor and snacks. I wasn't a fan of the espresso machine as most people just like plain old coffee. The room was very clean and nice with glasses rather than those yucky plastic coups you get at the Westin and other hotels that claim to be four stars. The bathroom was very large but, only had a shower (I'm a bath person) and I was told only the doubles had soak tubs? WHAT?!?!?!?! That was pretty disappointing but the bathrobes were nice, fluffy and clean. The staff was helpful and friendly but, I think the doormen could have been better about opening the doors rather than "hanging out" talking to their colleagues or other guests. There was an amazing jazz singer that performed in the lobby and that was a VERY NICE surprise as I didn't have to venture out to be entertained. The hotel staff front desk staff overall was friendly and very professional. They provided the the four-five star service you expect from the Fairmont. The only thing I didn't like is they did a "soft charge" to my card although I had already paid with Expedia online, it was called a "credit check"? HUH? Anyway, I would have to say overall I LOVED the Fairmont and would definitely stay here again as it right on the water and right at the North End which has nice little shops and spas. I say avoid the SPA if you are expecting friendly staff as I went there twice and not one time did the four women at the desk say hello. The SPA is nice and sells great clothing for yoga, lounging, etc. The restaurant menu is a bit pricey for "ok" dinner menu but the BREAKFAST WAS AMAZING!!! YUMMY! I would opt for one of the many amazing restaurants like Bricco (casual, friendly and GREAT food!). Park you car there at your own risk as they damaged my mirror but, agreed to pay for it to be repaired without any issues. Overall the Fairmont gets and A-. It is a great hotel, very clean, very nice, very comfortable and really a FIVE star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: zeestraat
Reviews.Content: We had a nice ocean view king room which was spacious and well appointed. Its location for visiting the North End or the TD sports arena is ideal. Entertainment (e.g., bar) is not part of the scenery of this hotel. Service for getting taxi or parking (expensive) could be slow. Had only once breakfast in the restaurant which was not special and somewhat pricey. Room service could be a bit more generous with providing toiletries, etc. We missed our nightly chocolate fix. Overall, a nice quiet hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Captain D
Reviews.Content: Be careful of booking thru a 3rd party as your room preferences/beds etc fall to the bottom of the totem poll. Rooms were very nice and well appointed. Restaurant was very good for breakfast although ridiculously overpriced. Service varied from good to excellent. If you don't want to hear the Coasties in the morning, ask to not to be on that side of the water. Great location in the North End and an easy walk anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but not the room I reserved.”
Reviews.Author: embassyworker
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Boston, Battery Wharf was very nice, great customer service & nice clean room. For a special occasion I had reserved an Ocean view King. This was a birthday and with a full moon I was willing to pay premium for the view. Upon arrival I was told you've been upgraded to a "junior sweet". Very nice room etc. Does it have an ocean view? NO. Matter of fact, it is the corner room at the entrance to the area with a busy 5 corner intersection. Breakfast was noteworthy in that when I ordered the "New England" breakfast on the menu the person taking the order had no idea what I was talking about. When the breakfast arrived it was incomplete & I had to make another call to get the rest of the breakfast. Pancakes were as heavy as you hear in horror stories. No light & fluffy in the description here. Very large, portions were huge, just VERY heavy. Sausage was delicious. Bathroom linens were beautiful. Should have a towel rack heater though. We were leaving when everyone else was I guess, and when I called for my car I was told there would be a 15 minute wait. More like half an hour until a driver came & asked what we drive...... I would try another place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: acesiif15
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on the waterfront with great views of Boston harbor. In the North End with some of the best restaurants. The history of Boston is at your front door. The rooms have everything you could ask for and the staff is friendly and eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Spuddler
Reviews.Content: With Boston all lodgings are more expensive than alot of cities. Combine that with parking cost and things add up. This is a super location for walking in Boston. Minutes from the TD Garden for a Bruins game and just a short walk to the North End or Quincy Market. Take some time roam around and enjoy the area. Become a Free Fairmont Presidents Club member for at least the free internet. It will save you 12 bucks a day plus you are eligble for other offers. Staff is friendy and the Valet bring the vehicles up quickly. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: jondf
Reviews.Content: One night stay on business, very friendly staff and large modern rooms. Pricey, but not more so than other more midline hotels in Boston. Many places to eat nearby, and some great views. Take the water taxi from Logan for a very unusual arrival experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Shannimal
Reviews.Content: This was out first stay in the north end area of Boston. We had planned to visit the New England Aquarium and chose this hotel because of the proximity being within walking distance. We were able to check in early at 11am. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Lots of great places to choose from for dining, coffee and scenery all within walking distance. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable by sending someone out to purchase a heating pad when they no longer had one available.

Reviews.Title: “Quality”
Reviews.Author: Bob1949
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Fairmont Battery Wharf. The first room we were allocated in which we spent the first night wasn't too good as it was on the top floor and beneath an air conditioning/service unit so I rumbled through the night (Room 5505) so I would recommend it is avoided. The next morning, when we spoke to the Receptionist we were given a choice of other rooms and settled on a corner junior suite which suited us perfectly. At all times the staff members were first class, friendly, obliging and professional, nothing was too much trouble. We stayed in the Gold building and therefore had access to the lounge throughout the day with complimentary breakfast and evening snacks between 5pm and 7pm and soft drinks throughout the day. An honesty bar operates for alcohol and you sign for the drinks you take and then this is added to the final bill. Wine is 7 dollars a glass so it is good value but Hilton Hotels have the edge here where the drinks in the Lounge are complimentary. In particular, we were impressed with Andrea and Emily who managed the Gold Lounge, they went over and above the call of duty to be helpful and we really appreciated everything they did to make our stay enjoyable. The hotel is well situated a five minute walk from the North End with great restaurants, a buzzing atmosphere and historical sites. The hotel is also a 10 to 15 minute walk from Long Wharf which is where the ferries/tour boats go from. As Boston is a small city the hotel is not really that far from anywhere. We would strongly recommend the Old town Trolly hop on hop off trolleys for tourists, great value and you see all the sites if you do the complete journey. It is also a good way to stay warm and dry if the weather turns cold and snowy as it did for us. All in all, the Fairmont Battery wharf was a great choice, by no means cheap but the quality was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: osparki
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 5 day/4night stay at the Fairmont Battery Wharf. I enjoyed the location as it was very quiet at night, and I slept very well. Beds were very comfortable, and the rooms nicely furnished, though the standard room was not very large. The rooms had a large flat screen and a dvd player. Bath products were not replaced once during our stay, except 1 bar of soap... I loved the proximity to dining in the North End, and I had a 10 minute walk to the T stop at Haymarket. I usually stay in the Theatre District, and while this location was not as convenient for my visits to my college attending daughter, it was worth it for the peace and quiet, and good night's sleep....

Reviews.Title: “First Class Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: brucegary
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip to Boston scheduled for mid-October, which is high season for tourists wanting to see the fall leaves. I was very lucky and booked this room at an outstanding price on through one of the airlines. At any price, this is a very nice hotel. The room was extremely modern decor and comfortable. While the location is somewhat isolated and out of the way from most other hotels, it is very close to Hanover Street, where all the good Italian restaurants are located in the North End. It is about an 8 block walk from the hotel to the nearest subway station. It was raining during my stay in the mornings, and I was able to quickly get a taxi on the first day, but not the second. The fitness center is in a nearby building and the spa offers yoga classes (at an extra charge).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Beautiful Property, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: aemlovesnegril
Reviews.Content: After my husband proposed to me on the boardwalk along the harbor at the Fairmont Battery Wharf, we decided to hold our wedding at the hotel. Our special day was flawless, my parents were absolutely thrilled and my friends are STILL talking about our beautiful wedding. The Fairmont is located on Boston Harbor - if you are visiting Boston from out-of-town, this is a great location due to its close proximity to the North End, Faneuil Hall, the TD Garden (sporting events), etc. The lobby of the hotel is gorgeous and the hotel restaurant Aragosta offers indoor and outdoor (seasonal seating on the water!) seating. We held a farewell brunch at Aragosta on Sunday and the food was beyond delicious and service was perfect. After the wedding reception, our guests moved into the Aragosta bar for drinks - the cocktails are all fantastic! The hotels rooms are beautifully decorated and very comfortable, I really loved the bedding and the modern decor. On my wedding night, we stayed in one of the Fairmont's suites - it was the most beautiful hotel room I have ever stayed in. The Fairmont Battery Wharf is a beautiful property and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Lancburm
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at this hotel recently. The location and service was average. However, the hotel is significantly overpriced. Our discounted rate of nearly $400/night got me a small room with queen bed and one chair. Internet and even their house red wine at the bar ($14/glass) was ridiculous. I am not overly familiar with the Boston area but I'm sure there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Great Harbor Location”
Reviews.Author: BostonBoater
Reviews.Content: If your looking to be on Boston Harbor and in the heart of the North End you'll enjoy your visit here. The hotel is only a few years old and the newness shows. Rooms are clean, linens are very nice and all guest rooms are located on the first and second floors so you feel very connected to the Boston Harbor Walk. The hotel staff is very friendly and responsive and I would stay here again. Before you book your stay be sure you aren't looking for a hotel near the Newbury Street shopping experience in the Back Bay which is a long walk or a $15 cab ride across the city.We are also looking forward to a visit to the Spa that looks fantastic. A couple minor quirks are the daily charge for the internet but that can be avoided by signing up to be a President's Club member for no charge. We also noticed a large spider squashed on the ceiling and we informed the front desk so I assume that will be removed when we check out. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: chart08
Reviews.Content: Fairmont was a pleasant place to stay. Not sure if I feel it was worth almost $400 a night (with taxes). Loved the complimentary soda and water made available near lobby. The breakfast was very nice. Water views were beautiful. Room was average. Walls were pretty thin and doors closing and ice machine sounded as if it was directly opposite our room wall (which it wasn't). There was suppose to be a king bed in our room and it ended up being a queen. They advertise a turn down service, which we never had. Didn't really like the "rain" shower with no door or curtain. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location was right down the street from North End.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Wedding”
Reviews.Author: jjohnson1997
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Wedding Me and my wife held our wedding in September at the Fairmont Battery Wharf and we cannot express how great the team at the Fairmont was and how great the venue turned out for our big day. Some items of note - We had planned to have the cocktail hour outside on the water front but the weather was a bit chilly so last minute we decided to split the cocktail hour between the outside and the maritime museum which worked perfectly. We were a little concerned originally of the split venue with the ball room and dining room separated. In the end the split worked perfectly with the separate ballroom helping people get off their feet and dancing. The food was exceptional and catered specifically to our tastes with off menu changes. We also had the Fairmont order specific beers from our hometowns that aren't normally offered at the hotel. The cake was beautifully displayed on a modern looking display in the ballroom. We also took advantage of the flat panels in the ballroom to display personalized slide shows that helped add an extra pop to the room. I want to give an extra shout out to Ashley Lamy, the catering manager at the Fairmont, for her patience, flexibility and pulling off an amazing event for us. And Kevin Grant for all his help with the AV requests. Definitely a great place to have a wedding in Boston, especially if you are looking for a modern venue and not another location in Boston with "interesting" carpet patterns.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel, that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: Rio1981
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel on the first part of our trip around New England, and overall the experience was good. I liked the fact that you can get a water taxi from the airport direct to the hotel, it's more expensive than just taking the T but obviously saves hassle, particulary when you've just stepped off a plane. The staff at the front desk were helpful and poilte and we got a room on the ground floor in building 2 I believe. No view to speak of but we didn't mind. Both the room and bathroom were modern, large and comfy with a flat screen TV and DVD player, the bathroom had both a shower and full size bath. We actually had 2 beds in the room and when we first entered I thought we had accidentally been given a Twin Room instead of a Double because of their size. I went to the front desk to ask about this and they said that they were indeed double beds. They were pretty small, particulary compared to other Double Rooms I've stayed in. The only other annoying point was the free Wifi. I signed up to their loyalty program specifically to make use of it but only one person could use it at any one time and you had to sign up again to use it at 24 hour intervals. I would have though standard free Wifi for however long you want it for would be pretty standard these days. We also had the experience of a fire alarm going off during our stay, apparantly for no reason, which was slightly unnerving, particulary as I was alseep at the time. The location is very good, right on the wharf and makes for a nice walk in the morning around to Qunicy Market or the North End etc for breakfast. It was also very quiet and we slept perfectly fine, apart from raging jetleg. Boston isn't a huge city and it was perfectly walkable to almost everywhere we wanted to go. I would say about 15-20 mins walk to Boston Common and about 10-15 to Qunicy Market. All in all a nice hotel for it's standard with a good location and nothing out of the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: findacruisedeal
Reviews.Content: Earlier this year I stayed at the Fairmont Battery Wharf. As the owner of a travel agency named findacruisedeal.com, I always look at hotels with the thought "would I book my clients here?" The answer is a resounding "Yes"! The hotel is located in a great spot. We were able to walk to most tourist spots or find easy access to a bus that took us took us to Fenway Park as we were there to watch baseball. There are plenty of great restaurants, parks and bakeries within a few blocks of the hotel. But what made the trip very special was the staff. Two staff members in particular, Molly and Lori were particularly helpful. I normally am a very active person who walks miles a day. But this trip was almost canceled due to severe back pain. In fact, two weeks after my stay I had back surgery. Since I couldn't walk without a lot of pain, these two ladies actually arranged for me to get a wheelchair. Without it I never would have made it to Fenway or to see the sites of Boston. I've stayed in hotels all over the world and have been to all seven continents. This stay is among those I will most remember with regard to exceptional hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Naveron
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Battery Wharf for a long weekend quick trip to Boston. This is a new building, so the rooms are all modern, very comfortable and functional. Great bed (made it hard to get up in the morning). Nice large bathroom with rainshower. Housekeeping staff seemed invisible but the room was made up well, with turn down service. We also ate at the restaurant which was very good. THe hotel's location is great. Walking distance to a number of shops, restaurants and tours. Last but not least, the staff were terrific. I would defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars for the Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: MariaLuvsNOLA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptional! This was one of the best hotel experiences I've had in a very long time. We got the Junior Suite (about 575 square feet) and it was VERY reasonably priced. In fact it was almost the same price as a standard room at a hotel downtown. The room was spotless and beautifully decorated. Not only was the bathroom squeaky clean, it was huge! It was exactly like a Japanese style bathroom, in the sense that the toilet was in a separate "room", and the shower/bath had it's own "room". The tub was deep and perfect for my two small kids. Once they finished their bath, they were able to get out of the tub and get rinsed off in the shower area. There was just so much space! The bed was very comfortable and had a lot of nice conveniences, like a reading light on each side. Even the crib for my son was quite large and nice. This particular Fairmont was opened in 2008, so this is probably why everything looked so brand new. Location, location, location. I love the fact that it's a little bit outside the chaos of downtown (yet it's still a convenient 5-10 minute drive away). But there are plenty of things to do/see within walking distance, like the New England Aquarium. Plus it's nice that it's by the water because the views were amazing and it was very quiet at night. Now..... customer service (the one part that is usually lacking, even in upscale hotels.) I was very impressed with all the staff - valet, front desk, concierge, room service, etc. Everyone was very friendly, helpful, and accommodating. I already miss this place and am trying to find another excuse to go back to Boston just so I can stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms, strange Fairmont Gold building”
Reviews.Author: nobo
Reviews.Content: The location is great - 10 minute walk from either blue or orange lines, adjacent to the North End, and right on the water. I was oddly "upgraded" to the strange Fairmont Gold outbuilding of sorts. Supposedly, this equals a higher standard of service or something. First, the private entrance with no doorperson made me feel less than safe. Yes, the complimentary snacks and breakfast were pretty awesome, but my room was not. It was small, there was no bathtub, the bedspread was pilly and worn, and a lot of things in the room were dusty - particularly the platform the bed was sitting on. The mattress was smaller than the platform - and the platform had lint, dust, leaves etc. very visible around right at the foot of the bed. The service in the restaurant was great, but the food itself, aside from the awesome bread, was disappointing. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing... but I really suspect this to be a Boston thing. It looks like a lot of restaurants in Boston are throwing ahi tuna, burrata and truffle oil on random dishes these days, and it doesn't always work.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: Lee4iv
Reviews.Content: great harbor views, friendly helpful staff, comfortable bed Walking distance to many attractions including TD Bank Garden. Large room and Nice bath . Robes provided, Espresso machine in room. For some reason the room was a little stuffy is only complaint

Reviews.Title: “Nothing better!”
Reviews.Author: carrieollie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is supreme. The location is fantastic. Can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jackfu123
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel screams elegance. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The rooms are stylish as well as comfortable. Get location on the water and close to North End neighborhood. Can even take the water taxi back to Logan. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Small with charm”
Reviews.Author: bshelton
Reviews.Content: Very nice location right at Battery Wharf. Easy walking to all many tourist attractions. It is really very easy to get around using public transit. The rooms were spacious for city style hotel rooms. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful. The daily breakfast and nightly honor bar were extremely well done. You can easily get from the Logan airport using the water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough”
Reviews.Author: JeannetteMeda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a magnificent location at the Boston Water Front. It is really about location, location, location. Convienent walk to all tourist locations plus the great food of the North End. Hotel has a good restaurant with outside waterfront seating which is lovely on a warm summers evening. The room was nice enough. We asked for a water view with the hopes of a balcony but hotel rooms do not have balconies. The water view was at an angle. The windows did not open to hear or feel the breezes but this may just be security for ground floor rooms. We had a lovely stay. The Battery Wharf neighborhood in Boston is a lovely newer neighborhood and is worth a strolll through. Parking $42/night. Try a lot a block away.....

Reviews.Title: “Been there, done that.”
Reviews.Author: Rocket C
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights here after learning that Boston Harbor Hotel (our favorite, bar none) was full. The rooms are nice--large, carefully decorated. We had no trouble booking connecting rooms for our kids and the reservationist was nice about allowing the dog ($25 charge). It felt a bit out of the way. The layout with rooms in different buildings is actually quite nice, although you miss the doormen if you are not in the main building. Housekeeping was in our faces on the last day, waiting for us to leave (we left at 10; they were trying to get into the room by 9.40; checkout is 11). The HarborWalk is extremely cool, and well worth seeing. I thought breakfast at the hotel restaurant was ridiculously expensive ($100+ for 3 adults and one child), and the service was polite but pretty distracted (we got our second cups of coffee right away, but by the time the extra cream arrived they were cold). There is no dog-walking service on-site, you have to book with the Dogfather of North End. (We did not, so I cannot review.) There are not too many places to walk a dog close to the hotel. There is no Concierge per se. The front desk will book reservations for you but they lack a concierge's knowhow regarding events in town. They're friendly and trying to be helpful, but they're pretty much doing as they're told. Not much expertise. No Pool. This is inexcusable, in my view: you had to pay for WiFi! There was a nice little "technology kit" for laptops, and free Ethernet, but WiFi was $15/day per person. We had dinner at Boston Harbor (Meritage) and got free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “best feature is the location”
Reviews.Author: liang57
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days in July with family. Hotel is set up differently than most as buildings are separate from each other. The building we stayed in was across from building with reception desk etc. Room was fairly clean and modern with nice bathroom and large flat screen TV. The beds are surrounded by a vinyl (or leather) rail...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaLeanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as part of our summer vacation. This place is beautiful and in a wonderful, safe part of the city. I worried a bit that it wasn't very close to the T, but it was a very short walk (10 mins) to the nearest station. And the walk is enjoyable too. We walked along the harbour and through a beautiful park to get to the Aquarium and the T is right there. A three minute walk will put you on Hanover Street where you'll find lots of restaurants and shops. Our room was upgraded upon check in to a harbour view. Very nice. The rooms are a little tight. There is no space for a cot. The bathroom however is spacious and had a wonderful soaker tub and a separate rainforest shower. As for the staff, we were mostly treated very well. The front desk and especially the guys at the front door were very friendly and helpful. The only negative came from one guy in the lounge. My husband and I just returned from an afternoon Red Sox game, still wearing our ballcaps and t-shirts. We sat down for a drink. I felt a bit unwelcome there. Don't know if there was a dress code, or if he was a Yankee fan. Other than that, do not hesitate to stay here. I would love to come back, and hope to in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Some ups, some downs”
Reviews.Author: lm1813
Reviews.Content: Arriving to the hotel by water taxi was a real treat, and check-in was smooth. Originally, I was a little dissapointed with the location of our room, located right off the lobby. Since this was a mother's day trip and getaway, I requested a different room, however they were fully-booked and could not accomodate the request. The layout of the hotel is a little odd in that guest rooms are fully visible and accessible from the lobby. While I was originally concerned about the noise, it ended up not being a problem as they have doors separating the lobby from the hallway where our room was, and they did shut the doors at night . The room was beautiful decorated and the beds were very comfortable. The bathrooms were excellent (clean, great decor, and huge, with a separate tub and shower, and plenty of counter space - I loved it! The hotel room doors were odd in that they didn't easily pull close and you could easily leave the door ajar - not great for security. Two experiences regarding service (1) I had some trouble connecting to the internet and staff was very helpful in solving that problem. (2) When we first arrived to our room first, in the corner there was some leftover trash on the floor that housekeeping missed - not a huge deal, but not the greatest thing to walk in and see upon arrival. We ate in the restaurant one morning and the service was fantastic! I also peeked at the meeting space on the lower level, which looked very inviting and appeared to be well-lit despite its location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice-but didn't feel like a Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: Okapi
Reviews.Content: Arrived here after spending 2 days at the Four Seasons. I wanted to experience a water location to get a different Boston feel. The hotel is very nice and new. The room is very modern and well appointed. However, I was not overly impressed with the staff. Except for one very enthusiastic lady at the front desk, the staff seemed didn't seem very engaged or professional to me. This was not the level of service or vibe I was expecting from a Fairmont. I was surpised to find that I felt isolated on Battery Wharf. The North End is right at your doorstep and the Aquarium along with the closest subway stop is about a 10 minute walk. I just felt disconnected from the city. A very nice hotel but a little different than I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: twosoups
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel located right on Boston Harbor and in the historic North End. The hotel is in 4 different buildings, but once you turn onto the wharf, the building with the Fairmont flags is the main one where you check in. The room was exquisite. After-dinner drinks and dessert on the terrace (right on the water!) Saturday night were fantastic. Room service breakfast was expensive but timely and worth it. A five-minute walk to North Square, the heart of the Italian North End enhanced our get-away week-end experience. Cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJG97
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great location, lovely staff but best of all there was a nespresso machine in the room! Breakfast was not included with the room and although it was delicious it was quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Jathebeach
Reviews.Content: Took my wife here for her birthday on New Year's Eve. The room was beautiful. The bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was nice. The shower was clean, but the rain forest shower head didn't flow as smoothly as the pictures on the web site make it seem. The location in the North End gave us plenty of options for good Italian dining. The concierge sent us to Limoncello....he told us to say he had sent us, but we didn't see any bonus from saying that. The concierge later told us that he eats for free, so I think we helped him more than he helped us, but the food was awesome. We went to the Atlantic Fish company the next night and it was incredible. We went to the Parker House for Boston Creme pie on New Year's Eve and were quite disappointed. The famous pie was actually quite ordinary...a little on the dry side. We took a city tour and visited the Aquarium. Overall it was an amazing weekend in Boston, and this hotel did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spad23
Reviews.Content: I was able to grab a last minute reduced price on a business trip to Boston and couldn't be happier with this choice. I was upgraded to a suite and had a nice view of the harbor. The room was amazing and the location for me was perfect. As always the Fairmont does not disappoint when it comes the decor, amenities and service. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “best feature is the location”
Reviews.Author: sunny35123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days in July with family. Hotel is set up differently than most as buildings are separate from each other. The building we stayed in was across from building with reception desk etc. Room was fairly clean and modern with nice bathroom and large flat screen TV. The beds are surrounded by a vinyl (or leather) rail which housekeeping forgot to clean. I did have to take a cloth and wipe something which had "spilled" and dried to the vinyl. Scrubbed off easily and did not bother mentioning it as did not want to make a big deal but gross just the same. We did find the room to be quite small. The only chair was the one that came with the desk. The air conditioner was located right beside the head of one of the two double beds. A bit noisy when trying to sleep. We did pay for a harbour view room which was nice. (we were on the side of the building at the end closest to the water.) The problem was that we were on the ground level and the surrounding shrubs and bushes had not been pruned and obstructed a fair bit of the view. Also, it was lovely to be able to open the windows but there were no screens on them. We soon had a few flies, so were not able to leave them open. I also noticed that the wallpaper in the corner of the bathroom was starting to peel. Although these may seem like minor details, they are all easy maintenance issues which should be addressed by a property charging these rates. Valet parking was nice but not cheap. You cannot access the parking garage without the valet so make sure you remove everything you may need from your vehicle. We only had breakfast at the hotel one morning. It was fine but expensive for the quality. The best thing about this hotel, as others have mentioned, is the location. We were able to walk to most things. The dining options in the north end are wonderful. It is lovely to be near the water, especially on a hot summer day. Although there did not appear to be a dedicated concierge, any recommendations from staff were always very good. Would consider staying again next time we're in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stylish room, staff could have been more on the ball”
Reviews.Author: WandererOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for one night. Was very happy with the location, great for strolling, and also with the fabulous water view. The room was very stylish and comfortable, though if I'd realized that it didn't have a bath, I might not have chosen it. My only unhappiness was that although the front desk staff were very friendly and prompt at checking me in and out, they weren't at all helpful with two problems I had. First, I was unable to sign in on the hotel's wireless network, and when I followed the on-screen instruction to contact the front desk, I was told their engineer would come to my room to fix the problem. That would have been great if he had ever arrived, but after well over an hour I resorted to calling the service provider's own helpline, spending ten minutes on hold, and then finally getting them to fix the problem directly. Second, I had been told to book my water taxi to Logan airport through the front desk, which I did. Ten minutes after my scheduled departure time, however, when a water taxi finally showed up, he said that he didn't have a booking for me, and therefore couldn't take me. I phoned the front desk, to which I only got through after four minutes on hold, and was just vaguely told that someone would inquire about the problem. Fortunately, the next water taxi operator to show up didn't mind taking me, even though he also didn't have my booking either. Also fortunately, I had left a lot of time before my flight, so I wasn't too worried (though if someone had told me that I would then have to wait half-an-hour for the shuttle bus on the other side of the water, I would probably have just taken a cab to the airport and foregone what was othewise an enjoyable boat ride).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful and Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Bratley
Reviews.Content: Nice beautiful hotel on the water. They treat you like royality. Within walking distance to lots of places. Attended a wedding there. Wonderful venue. Eat in North End...yummy italian....Loved it. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room”
Reviews.Author: dutchessnancy
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband on business and stayed at the lovely Fairmont Battery Wharf. It is in a very nice neighborhood in the North End With an excellent view of the harbor. We were upgraded to a large room with a view and very comfortable amenities. The bathroom was large and clean. There was a very nice dining area for a continental breakfast and late afternoon complimentary snacks. The staff was very acommidating. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location;so-so staff and room quality”
Reviews.Author: traveler from Hinsdale
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel. We took the water taxi from Logan and it was like being in Venice. The taxi stops at the Fairmont's dock which is so convenient and help make up for the fact that getting to the water taxi isn't ( the bus comes infrequently and makes several stops before getting to the water taxi dock). The hotel is right on the water at the foot of the North End convenient to the aquarium, TD Banknorth, Faneuil Hall, the Science Museum and Mike's Pastry! I loved looking at the water from the room and walking along the docks in the morning. On the negative side, the rooms are smallish with space saving features that don't work too well. For example, the bathrooms have sliding doors with no stops so they tend to slam noisily when opened. Similarly the glass-paneled toilet and shower doors also tended to clang shut. We had two rooms, with connecting doors, but the hotel did not have any way to keep the door opened and the desk staff appear flummoxed by our requested for door stops. We noticed the guests across the hall were using pillows to keep their doors open; we employed hangers. In general, the women who worked at the front desk were helpful with directions, but the men ranged from from clueless to rude. There was no actual certified concierge, which seems unacceptable in a hotel with these rates. I would also note that the rooms have very low ceilings and the king rooms do not have bathtubs, again surprising given the rates being charged. The air conditioner was quite loud and went on and off frequently which would bother a light sleeper. On the positive, there were plenty of electrical outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KeriS7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and it's location is perfect. The rooms are gorgeous-granite counter tops and glass showers. The beds were so comfy. It's located right near fanuiel hall and a short drive for dinner in the north end. The staff is very accommodating and there is valet parking available- which is great for being in the city. Joe's Bar and Grill down the street is a great place to go to for a Sunday brunch- it was about $12 for mimosas and a generous meal.

Reviews.Title: “Superior staff, great room!”
Reviews.Author: intlwanderlust
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last summer on business. When I arrived, after a long, intl flight, i was told my room would be ready in 2 hours, if I wanted to go walk around. I told them I was exhausted and just would wait (or maybe sleep) in the lobby. They then asked how important a view was to me, because my proposed room was overlooking the hahbah. I was happy with a room sans view as long as it was quiet and had a nice bed. They then got me another room. The girl at the desk was incredible. Not only did she help me with my suitcase (which I could have done) but she showed me my room, how to operate the electronics and even let me know which of the nespresso capsules were her fave. I then realized I forgot my power cable to my laptop (I'm not normally this bad), and asked if by any chance someone had one I could borrow while they were working? Well, within ten minutes a guy came in with two to try. And luckily one worked! The team here rocks and they made my stay so enjoyable and special. The room was also great - quiet, large, great bathroom, comfortable bed, fast wifi. Perfect in every way. They also have a gym nearby which, while small, is adequate. Definitely good for a business or personal trip.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, wonderful city. We didn't want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: MickRLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful five night stay at this hotel and quite frankly didn't want to leave. Upon checking in we decided to see if there were any upgrades available as we'd had a few unpleasant surprises in various hotels in Canada over the two weeks prior to arriving in Boston. We had originally booked into a Junior Suite but decided maybe something with a full harbour view would be better. The Concierge was extremely helpful and we ended up in Room 4140 which was exquisite. We had a full harbour view and spent many happy hours watching all the sailing out on our private terrace area. The Room/Suite was so lovely that we actually stayed in and had Room Service on two nights just so we could enjoy it more. Room Service was prompt and delicious - make sure you try the lobster on brioche!! The bedroom was spacious and the bathroom a lovely size with a shower to die for. I can't thank the Concierge enough for sorting this room out for us at short notice, we had a fantastic time at this hotel and it made a really great end to out Canadian/American adventure. Highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Aragosta makes a great dining spot here”
Reviews.Author: Lisab
Reviews.Content: A 'thumbs up' for the Aragosta Bar and Bistro. One afternoon was here after a long walk along Boston's harbor waterfront ... the Lobster/WhiteBeanPuree/Crostini was delicious! So fresh and light, the crostini crispy through, no rubbery chewy quality that can happen if unattended, and no charred spots if unattended too long. Loaded with lobster and the white bean puree, such a modern take on the New England/Atlantic Navy Bean tradition. Returned a few days later for weekend brunch. Got the typical Eggs Benedict, but the Aragosta made it great! No mass-produced Canadian Bacon but a generous amount of delicately thin sliced Vermont Ham, the best English Muffin imaginable, the eggs perfectly poached and a delicate Hollandaise sauce. They took typical and made it special! Wish the waterfront views were a bit more scenic ... but still nicer than the typical 'indoor' restaurant. Would recommend this as a nice stop for anyone doing Boston's Harborwalk or seeing the sights 'next door' in The North End.

Reviews.Title: “My first review and an excellent one...”
Reviews.Author: virgingirlvirgingirl
Reviews.Content: I was on a fun little trip up to Boston and P-town and only needed one night, Sunday June 26th till early the next morning. I was stunned when I was able to get a room at the Fairmont for a great price. Not only did their website provide an accurate photo of the hotel itself, it truly outshone itself all around. I was greeted by a lady with a huge smile, who was welcoming and friendly and helpful. Not only did she check me in with expedience, but showed me right to my room, which yes was close by, but the extra step of her showing me the room and telling me how every thing worked, was just an extra special touch. That night another person helped me get my boarding passes for the next morning and was just as friendly. Score huge points for stepping into a place and feeling very welcomed. To the manager here, you have a great crew. We didn't take them up on their huge discount for the restaurant, but if I were staying another night, I would have. All in all, as a hotel, it was gorgeous. As much as I am a dog lover, some one was inconsiderate enough to either leave their dog there alone as he/she barked for quite a while. I think it is great that hotels offer pets a place to stay, but guests can't expect it to be like a kennel and simply leave them alone. Either that or they snuck him/her in! But even that, I would give this hotel the highest marks all around. While I wish I could have peeked into their gym/pool, I didn't have time, but I am sure it would have been clean and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful environment”
Reviews.Author: wendytruth
Reviews.Content: I love hotels that seem like home rather than a hotel. This fits this category if you stay in the "gold" or signature area of the hotel. It is a dedicated building where you can get a cup of coffee etc all day long. If it is nice weather you can sit outside on the terrace by the water. The concierge's are amazingly knowlegdable and go out of their way to make reservations, give you maps etc. I call before I even get there and they have everything waiting for me in my room. The rooms are brand new with flat screen TV's and all the amenities are high end. There is a restaurant in the main part of the hotel and that is the only drawback - I found the menu limited and very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “All around pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dutchman21
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great rooms, nice view and good food. We stayed for four nights and had a wonderful experience. The staff is friendly and attentive, the food was excellent and the room had all the amenities we wanted and more. (for example: There was a system to hook up our notebook to the TV and we watched some Hulu TV that way.) The view of Boston Harbor provides a nice scenery with sail boats and big ocean ships passing by all the time. It is a 10 minute walk to the metro system, but very easy to reach from the airport by water taxi (recommended, as it is entertainment in itself!) The internet is free if you are a President's Club Member and you can sign up at the check-in. (otherwise it is $15.95, the President's Club is free.)

Reviews.Title: “They just can't get it right”
Reviews.Author: houseelfdobby
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times but I think it is finally time to give up. My most recent stays were two weekends on either side of a week long vacation. The night on the front of the stay was fine-no problems. The night at the end of the stay was terrible. First they just can't get the front of the house right and after meeting one of the "managers" this is not a surprise. I was traveling with my elderly (but with it) mother.
