Upon arrival-no help out front with bags (in the pouring rain). Ck in and get to room. Mother is diabetic so need fridge to store meds. Fridge totally empty. Call front desk to have it stocked-this takes two hours and 4 phone calls. However get back to room after dinner and fridge not working-not cold at all. Issue never gets resolved. Have early flight in the morning so use the express breakfast card to order so mother can have something to eat before we leave-card has spot to pick time for delivery. Pick the 6:15am to 6:30am slot. 6:35am no food. Call the front desk and told that the delivery person (only one???) does not get in until 6:30-was late but will start delivery. Why do you offer a 6:15-6:30 time when the person is not there to deliver. 6:50am-no food and have to head to airport. Go to desk to check out and again explain how poor this stay has been. No help from desk person so ask for card so I can contact the manager. Love this part-desk person yells to back office "Megan can I have one of your cards" . Megan yells "sure" does not ask why, can she be of service-NOTHING. Just says do you want the directors card? and gives me that. Great manager! These are not new problems with this hotel. I have been staying at this hotel since it re-opened and they keep breaking my heart. Love the location etc but it is time to find another favorite and there are plenty to choose from in Boston. This is not an inexpensive place to stay and they just do not live up to their pricing. One plus is the new restaurant is outstanding and the Exhale Spa is wonderful. Both can be used without being a guest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous New Hotel, Convenient Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Shareee
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fairmont Battery Wharf for two nights, midweek, in April. Our room was a partial harborview room, on the first floor. The rooms are new, modern, with extremely comfortable beds, beautiful bathroom and have a Nescafe machine, stocked with different types of espresso -- a very nice touch.There is a table in the room, with two chairs--a perfect place to work. The staff was courteous, friendly and extremely helpful, something you don't always see in a city hotel. The location was fabulous, very close to the North End, Fanueil Hall but a good walk from downtown. Parking was expensive but convenient because of the valet. We loved walking around the area and found it a perfect spot while staying in Boston. I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “As a seasoned traveler, I am VERY impressed”
Reviews.Author: OneThird
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for both business and pleasure. I don't limit myself to Fairmont Hotels, but I have stayed in several of them. But the Battery Wharf is quite different than any other of the Fairmont's I have ever stayed in. Most Fairmont's are old-school and elegant. This one was more modern and trendy. The rainshower is DIVINE. The amenities are well thought-out and the concierge is always attentive and ready to assist. The view of the harbour is very peaceful and the location is perfect walking distance to all of Boston, the Boston Common, Faneuil Hall, the famous North End, etc... We stayed for 3 nights and didn't take our car out once. Not only would I recommend this hotel, I think that I would come back to Boston just to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Boston's Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: Smitten
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from Boston after spending 5 nights at the Fairmont Battery Wharf - What can I say - I didn't want to leave. This year I stayed in the Gold Building and it is definitely worth the extra $$ -= The care and attention you receive is simply over the top. It includes the common lounge area which is on the main level and brightly lit. Breakfast is so good as well the evening nibblies reaches far beyond anyones expectations - . The gym/spa is right there although I never used it. Last week they just opened their new restaurant in the main building - it needed a change from Sensing - and the menu is to die for. I ate there one night and had a hard time deciding what to choose, it all looks good and very very generous portions. It has a much better atmosphere and the service is top notch. People have always complained about the price of parking at hotels- but take a look around Boston the fees are crazy not just at the Battery Wharf - I didn't rent a car. The T is close by - a Charlie Card is a must and I liked taking the Aquarium stop because you walk along the wharf. You are also close the the Italian neighbourhood great restaurants and if you take in a hockey or basketball game it's a quick 10 minute walk in the other direction. It's Boston's best kept secret the Fairmont Battery Wharf, I'll be back next year - I can't wait !

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - misleading waterfront image”
Reviews.Author: Mainah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Fairmont last Friday and like all Fairmontsâ€¦ it was great. The staff was all super friendly, the North End location very convenient, our room was quite large, very well appointed and I think we were one of the lucky few who had a true water view (albeit between 2 buildings). The main thing we would warn potential new guests of is that the Fairmonts main promotional photo shows 2 buildings hanging out over the water loaded with balconies. This is actually very misleading as all of the end units you see in this image with large balconies are private residences and not the hotel! So do not expect a balcony and probably not much, if any, water view. We were in the Gold Building on the left which actually is the 3rd building from the water and we were told has 2 rooms with balconies. Again, we did have very nice 3rd floor corner room, water view with no room noise. We also dined at the new restaurant (they just opened a few days prior to our arrival) and they have some things to work thru. The staff was very friendly but maybe not quite ready and some of our food plates were very good, others bland. The outdoor seating will be amazing come summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, gym facilities, and fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: snorkelingsearchers
Reviews.Content: We booked this on the William shatner site and our room location may have suffered, as we were on the first floor with no view and next to the exit doors which loudly slammed shut all night long on Friday and Saturday night ruining our sleep. Otherwise the hotel was a home run! I am partial to my workout time and the gym facilities are amazing although the hours were a little limited 8am-8pm on the weekends (I would have preferred to work out earlier as to not waste daylight hours in the gym). Service was good and the room was well appointed with a very comfortable bed and neat nespresso machine. The location, however, is why I would return to this hotel. Very convenient water taxi ride to the airport, nice quiet area, but only blocks from the glorious North End, which is full of great restaurants, cages, and nighttime happenings. Also any easy walk to downtown and the freedom trail. What a great place - I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: BorderRambler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last July and loved it. The hotel seemed so modern and clean, with the rooms following this trend. It was extra nice to jump off a water taxi and into the hotel complex, nice and easy. We had a view over looking a water inlet too which was nice. Large rooms were very plush and luxurious with a lot of storage, with fantastic beds and nice bathrooms inc walk in multi-shower cubicle and robes etc. Mod cons were a nice touch too with large wall-mounted TV, mini-fridge and Nespresso coffee maker. Had one problem with loud TV/music on first night keeping us up from somewhere, issue was dealt with promptly by security. Staff friendly and helpful. Location ideal if you like the North End, strolling onto Hanover St in seconds and to numerous bakeries/cafes/bars/restaurants. 10-15mins to the harbour and into town so good for that too. Look forward to staying here when next in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great location, slightly pricey”
Reviews.Author: bubble132
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just the weekend in the summer last year. Despite the rooms being a little pricey, it's a great hotel. The first thing that was impressive was the security - there are 5 separate buildings of rooms, and your key card is specific for your building, as well as your floor and obviously your room. The room was huge, as was the bed which was extremely comfortable, big TV, lovely bathroom. Service was great, everyone very helpful and friendly. The bar is nice too and the food was good. Very cool location too, right on the harbour. Nice and quiet but walk across the street and you're right in the city (don't know much about the layout of Boston but the Aquarium's just up the road along with some great Irish pubs and the famous Beantown Pub!) The only thing I can say that was slightly annoying was paying quite a lot for both internet and parking - you would think that for the price you're paying for the hotel, both those things would be free or cheaper. But that's the only bad thing I can say!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shynk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights here in March. Here is the run down: The Excellent: The room was amazing! The rain shower head was a nice touch. Very modern with fantastic linen. The tv and its location was perfect. Love that there were wine glasses in the room. The Good: The service was great. The staff remembered our names from check in. They were very helpful with directions and maps. Their bostonian accents were great too ;) The view is amazing. The location is good but not right downtown. The not so good: lack of annonimty.........you have to call to get ice as you don't have access to the ice machine yourself. No pool or bathtubs. The bad: Valet parking only is pretty pricey. One night had coffee and desert in the restaurant.....probably the worst desert we have ever eaten but at least we could laugh about it!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, perfect locations, beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: lainey1981
Reviews.Content: 9 of us went to Boston for my 30th birthday from March 17 to March 20. We had a great greeting upon our arrival and were very impressed when we walked into the room. Very spacious, beautiful bathroom, very comfy bed, huge tv, very modern. The staff was always helping us with directions, reservations, the front door staff always had a smile on there faces greeting us. Made us feel very welcomed. We had breakfast and Sensing. The food was great but the service even better. Felt very warm. Location was great for us, near restaurants and sightseeing. We also took the water taxi to the airport which was $10. You just let the front desk know what time you want to go at and they will arrange it for you. I plan on visiting Boston again and would recommend and stay at the Fairmont Battery Wharf again. Thanks for a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: depgirl
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the last poster about the noise. Hotel doors slam shut making a loud noise and waking me up. Invest in door silencers! Furthermore, can clearly hear cinversations from the hallway. If there were only another door between the entrance and the bedroom area, this would quiet things down a lot. If you do stay here, make sure the hotel is not fully booked, especiallt with rowdy kids in my case. Brand new does not mean quiet, and modern comforts do not make up for lack of soundproofing and a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty is Skin Deep”
Reviews.Author: pleaseread
Reviews.Content: The bottom line is the service is awful!!!!!! I traveled with my son for 4 days to Boston to see the freedom trail/monuments etc. The Boston Bairmont Battery Wharf had such good reviews I felt we couldn't go wrong. Here are some problems we noticed. - If you think you are paying for a Harbor View Room you are likely paying for a water view room. We ended up with a view of the wharf and a very heavy sales pitch to upgrade to a nice view of the harbor. Of course that would be another $70. Anyways our harborview room ended up being a view of the coast guard station, no harbor at all. So beware if you think you are getting a view of the harbor. - Room Service - Food is really really bad and very expensive. The first night we ordered two meals and I received the wrong meal. I ordered the lobster club and was given a lobster roll. I told her this was incorrect, and she said this is what the lobster club looks like now. Unbelievable. - Bathroom - The bathrooms are nice however ours had a few problems. Our sink faucet literally lifted out of the marble countertop every time you used it. Also there were not many bath products (1 soap, 1 shampoo, 1 conditioner). - Restaurant - "Sensing" is the name of the restaurant. The first morning we dined at sensing, the food was pretty good. They serve your breakfast with a unripened tomato with a strange green topping. Tried it twice and YUCK! They also serve your breakfast with carrots and asparagus (COLD). The bread is also very bad. Servers look very unhappy and understaffed. That night we tried having in room dining but I was put on hold and staff never picked up the call again. So we walked down to the restaurant and there was no hostess to seat us. We kept waiting and nobody helped us so we returned to the restaurant in an hour and waited to be seated again. We caught the attention of a waitress, asked if there was a hostess who could seat us and she said the hostess is sick tonight and didn't offer to seat us! We went back to our room and finally got through to room service to order two hamburgers. So here is the funny part. No bottle opener was delivered for my diet coke. I called room service and they said someone would deliver one right away. Never came. I went out to the desk after all my ice had melted and they said they are running very low on bottle openers and she would go get her car keys! OMG! Is this really a hotel? - The noise - When we arrived there was a dog barking out side our window once an hour every hour. Also when the neighbors are using the bathroom is it very very loud. I could go on and on... I have never been treated this poorly at a hotel. Bummer

Reviews.Title: “The Truth About Battery Wharf”
Reviews.Author: cramerproduction
Reviews.Content: This review is long over due but none the less here it is. I have been staying at the Fairmont Battery Wharf since it first opened several years ago. In the summers I am always enchanted by there lovely seaside location. I have stayed in every category of room at the hotel and each is consistent with all basic amenities, from the Eliot suite to the smallest basic fairmont room. I travel weekly and the one thing I look for is consistency , this hotel always reminds me why I choose the Fairmont brand. Nespresso Machines in every room, plush and oversized bath towels ( some room have tubs with bath salts !!! ), luxury rainforest showers , turn down service in every category of room with water!!!! , sirus xm in room with a nice sound system , windows that open , PERFECT beds with soft sheets and oversized pillows and every rooms is clean ( no stains on the carpet or scratched up furniture, this place is maintained) Room service is outstanding, fast, courteous, and reasonably priced. Desk staff is always smiling and willing to do all they can for you. Emily the gold manager , will always go above and beyond to make your stay that much more enjoyable! The gold lounge is just stunning. Fireside seating in the winter and outdoor patio space along boston harbor in the summer. The food is delicious and always varying and the wine selection is just right. Breakfast is hot and bountiful. I highly recommend the gold if you are spending more then a night at the hotel. The location is a bit out of the way for downtown attractions but for this type of quality it is worth the $10 cab ride to go downtown. The Boston harbor suites are ideal for meetings, small get togethers , or that pre wedding reception. The patio space is phenomenal for lounging on a summer afternoon with a cold beer ! It's not HUGE but it has that just right feel. I can not wait to try there new spa opening this month ! Working in high end travel I have a very discerning eye and this hotel always meets and exceeds my expectations. Ryan S.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Lukko4SOV
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Battery Wharf for 3 nights in early February. Great location, close to everything. Took the water taxi from the airport for $20 and took a taxi back to the airport for $20, so either way, easy to get to and cheap. Didn't try any of the food at the hotel as prices are fairly high, however using grubhub.com had food delivered to the hotel. Rooms were cleaned impeccably, and the staff was always willing to answer a question or help out with anything they could. We'll definitely be back when the weather's a little better!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: sexonthebeach150
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely fabulous. I've only ever stayed in the Gold Rooms, but the Gold Concierge (John & Ishan) are both great, the breakfast, evening apps, and evening desserts are also fantastic. The rooms are luxuriously appointed and the views are nice. The hotel is a bit down Commercial Street, within the North End, but with walking distance to Faneuil and Govt. Ctr. Anywhere else, you'll probably need to use the T/drive/cab. Great rooms at a great price! Definitely recommend it over their sister in Copley Place. Also, free internet in your room if you're in the President's Club (free enrollment online).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but beware if you have a toddler”
Reviews.Author: charliesmum
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Fairmont; great hotel, good room service, attentive staff and good location, also got a geat internet rate. The room was typically fabulous for this kind of hotel, but also truly impractical for travel with a toddler! Too many sharp edges and breakable decor. Otherwise highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Spot on the Water”
Reviews.Author: meritagebc
Reviews.Content: We arrived late after a full day of sightseeing the staff greeted us with warm hospitality. We were escorted to our rooms located in the opposite tower from the main building. What luxury! We stayed here for two additional nights after one night stay at the Fairmont Copley Plaza. I would choose Battery Wharf any day! The room was outstanding and furnished with the most up to date amenities. The room was very clean and attended to very well. The in room espresso maker was a great feature - and made it very convenient to enjoy a cuppa while enjoying the morning view. We had an opportunity to eat room service, and dine in the lounge. Both meals were well price, well prepared/presented and very tasty! The bar served local craft beer which I adore when travelling in a new destination. Overall a great choice and would choose to stay here again if I find myself in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “low-key luxury with free chocolate bar”
Reviews.Author: mclin7
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful, luxurious, attention to details hotel. Did anybody mention the complementary hot chocolate bar at the lobby? It offers marshmallows, whipped cream, different sprinkles and wonderful hot chocolate, neither too sweet nor too thick. Much better than any hot chocolate I get in NY, even better than the City Bakery. Perfect! And perfect for little kids. My girls screamed when they saw the chocolate bar. The Nespresso automatic espresso machine in the room caught my eyes. I have never been to a hotel with such high end coffee machine. The six capsules are strong and delish!!! Marble bathtub, sink, floor, separate shower room; thick hardwood table and cabinet, designer LED bedside lights, and the leather chair, just name a few to tell you how low-key luxury Fairmont Battery Wharf Hotel is. The turn-down service is another nice touch. Though the $42 overnight valet parking is a little steep; it offers unlimited in and out, which is convenient for travelers. Highly highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, good proximity to North End”
Reviews.Author: laurendell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on our way up from NJ to Maine. Arrivated late, left mid-day the next day, so didn't spend too much time in the room, but it met all our needs. I stay in a lot of Fairmonts for work, so was using a free-night voucher, so can't comment on value for $ really. Room: As in all Fairmonts, the bed and pillows are awesome. The bathroom was large and luxurious. The room was a good size and very modern and clean and had a luxe feel. No complaints. Service: The valet parking was quick and friendly. The staff (check-in, bellhop) were also very friendly and polite. Location: We didn't really spend much time in Boston (just breakfast the next day). Depending on what you want to do, the location could be good or bad. If you like the history and restaurants of the North End, it's great. If you want to be closer to Newburry(?) St and Boston Commons, you could do better. It's nice that it's right on the water I think. All in all, if the location works for you, and you like a more modern, new, hotel, it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer51
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this Hotel. Great location, wonderful room, quiet and peaceful which I really needed after a long flight. I did not eat in the Restaurant, way too many good places/ restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont enters the 21st Century”
Reviews.Author: simonbill1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights 29/12 to 02/01/2011. Stayed in several Fairmont hotels but this is the most modern. Very efficient staff at the front desk, spent 4 days trying to find our missing luggage courtesy of Delta/KLM leaving my wife's case in Amsterdam. Room was just what we needed; King-size bed very comfortable, elegant bathroom with screened toilet. TV system good quality. Lobby Guy's very welcoming and knowledgeable; not many will find a table in a good restaurant on New Years Eve at an hours notice!! We will be back in Boston during February for the Hockey (another reason for using this hotel close to the TD Bankworth garden) and will be once again using this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jensamsmom
Reviews.Content: We booked the Fairmont Battery Wharf for New Year's Eve. The location is great. Very close to the North End and with a pretty good Boston Harbor view. The staff was very professional with a very speedy check-in. The room was clean, spacious and well appointed. The bed was reasonably comfortable and everything was in working order. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel the staff and service was one of the best.”
Reviews.Author: zanon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Battery Wharf for my son's 10th birthday. The staff went out of their way to make his birthday an event to remember. The entire staff signed a card and knew who he was before we got out of our car. Everyone we worked with from check in to room service was wonderful. The location is excellent, easy to get to the North End and downtown shopping. We will stay there again and would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Love the North End? Then you'll LOVE the Fairmont Battery Wharf?”
Reviews.Author: cyndec
Reviews.Content: Our room was pristine and quiet. The front desk service helpful and courteous. The men at the front door / valet were consistent and diligent. Our room service meal was tasty and timely...and for us, FREE! They didn't charge us because their menu was limited (even when we told them that what they had available was what we were going to order anyway). The bed was very comfortable. Although all was great...the REAL reason we liked this place, was because we love the North End and found it very convenient to walk back to our place after our late night italian meals, coffees and pastries. Though we wandered back late most nights, never did we feel insecure or unsafe. The walk to the trolley stop was also very do-able. Overall...we made the right choice staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: OvertheCascades
Reviews.Content: I like Fairmont Hotels in general - however, the Fairmont Battery Wharf is even better. New construction, beautiful views from many rooms, very friendly staff plus a great location. We walked to the Freedom Trail from the hotel - very walkable for my parents and me. The lady at Front Desk gave us a tour of the room. The room was so clean. The experience was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with kids to explore Boston.”
Reviews.Author: WeGoMama
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston as our kids were learning about the age of the discovers and the formation of our country. Our hotel was very well situated with a charming staff. Our breakfasts were truly yummy. Our kids loved the view of the water from our very spacious corner room. I wish we could have taken the water taxi from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Save everything you sign....”
Reviews.Author: ericky1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend in July...everything went well (except our TV broke the second night and we had a repairman in there for an hour at 3am...how romantic) until about three months later when they unexpectedly charged me for our second night. I had booked the stay through a third party and upon check out, was informed all charges were taken care of and when i asked for a receipt several times, they told me there were no charges and had no receipt. Fast forward to November, and I see a charge on my bank account for the equivalent of a night stay. Ok...I may or may not owe this. I"m not sure because I used a different card with the third party and have to contact them (I closed the card), but what kind of business charges you that amount of money out of blue without any attempt to contact you? And why on earth do you still have my credit card information on file? They couldn't produce anything that I signed, authorizing the charge and refused to refund the charges. And it's so sneaky because, according to my bank, since the services were rendered more than 20 days ago, there's nothing my bank can do for me either. Such bad business. I'll never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been any smoother”
Reviews.Author: okragen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a pleasure. My boyfriend and I went for a one night stay and arrived late that night. The staff was extremely accomadating and helpful, even walking us to our room. The room itself was great, clean, modern and simple. The bed was extremely comfortable and the dark curtains allowed for a very very deep sleep. The next morning we enjoyed the location of the hotel, in the heart of the North End. I truly recommend this hotel for its location, service and value!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet”
Reviews.Author: JudyAC
Reviews.Content: We didnt stay at this hotel, but did check it out and view a room. Seems like it would be a great hotel if you want a quiet area of town. We thought it might be fun to stay closer to the action part of the time, and here part of the time. The hotel is on the wharf, and a short walk from both North End (Italian and history) and Faneuil Hall area (shops and street performers). The rooms were nice, and the staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “This is probably a great hotel for business, not for leisure though”
Reviews.Author: joanas
Reviews.Content: I got a good price for this hotel on a travel site. I decided to try it, though I usually stay elsewhere when I am in Boston. Let me cut to the quick: 1. Hotel has very big rooms and bathrooms (marble) 2. This is absolutely "no frills" though it is clean and modern. Very masculine. 3. I can't tell you about the "bar" or "restaurant" personally, as I was not even interested looking for it. 4. This hotel was made for a businessman's trip. Women, go elsewhere. 5. You will probably not stay where there is a front desk, bar, or restaurant in your building. There are 4 different buildings and the 1st and 2nd floor are the hotel rooms. Of course there is no ice machine, so one must wait for room service from another building to bring you ice. 6. Be prepared to direct every taxi to your hotel, as no one appears to know where this hotel is, though it has been opened for 2 years. 7. The hotel has no concierge, as they will tell you that all that work at the desk are the "concierge" 8. If you need a cab fast, you are out of luck 9. Better know where you are going in the North End, (which is basically where the hotel is), because believe me, no one at the hotel knows where anything is. 10. If you want to see Boston for vacation reasons, avoid this hotel, as you really pretty much already need to know what there is and how to get there. 11. Room service breakfast sucks. Pancakes were heavy and ice water must be asked for. 12. Hotel is not near anything, but would really be ideal for hiding out, in case you ever want to. (This is why taxis cost more than you will ever spend anywhere else in Boston) 13. Restaurant menu at the hotel, "Sensing" looks like an overpriced 1990's menu. I d don't see this becoming a place to dine in Boston, as there are so many more reasonable and delicious cuisine to be had

Reviews.Title: “Great North End Location, Very Comfortable, Boston Harbor Views, Expensive”
Reviews.Author: TravDean
Reviews.Content: This Fairmont hotel is only two years old. We scheduled a three day mini-vacation in Boston. The staff is very friendly. From talking to the help, it seems that they are very happy with management. The chamber maid told me that she cares for only 12 rooms while some other hotels in Boston assign as many as 20 rooms per shift. That translates to a very clean hotel and attentive staff. The hotel seems to focus on the business traveler but had an international leisure guest clientel- several European guests. We enjoyed the location in the North End easy walking to fabulous Italian Restaurants. A pleasant surprise on check out was being told that the quoted reservation rate was wrong and that the total room cost was $128.00 less. One suggestion is for guests to joins the Fairmont President's Club (It is free) to receive complimentary internet access, free local phone calls, daily newspaper of your choice as a perk.

Reviews.Title: “A Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: TheGil
Reviews.Content: My wife, four year old son, and I just returned from a three night stay in Boston at the Fairmont. The hotel is very modern and stylish. The staff were very friendly at check-in and gave us some pointers on restaurants, attractions, etc. I did find the front desk staff to be somewhat indifferent after the initial check-in. I made a few requests (shower cap for my wife, luggage cart at departure) that were handled in a timely fashion, but the voices at the other end were not at all friendly. The room was very clean and fresh. I particularly enjoyed the shower! Beds were very comfortable, but the pillows were not to my liking, as they were not firm at all. Location of the hotel is very good for North End restaurants, much of the Freedom Trail, and TD Garden for Celtics / Bruins games. We walked everywhere and always felt comfortable. We did take a water taxi to the airport, which we very much enjoyed. The hotel will contact the taxi company. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont. Boston is a beautiful and clean city.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel and Best Accommodating Staff in Boston”
Reviews.Author: marern
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the beauty our room. The location and the wonderful staff of this hotel. We were pleasantly greet everyday by the staff who could not do enough for us. Always with a smile. They printed out directions for us to go shopping and locations in Boston for sightseeing. The hotel was within walking distance of Quincy Market and many historical sites in Boston. Friends were staying in another hotel in Boston for less money and got no amenities. My husband and I loved this hotel!! We are definitely planning to come back again in warmer weather. There are a lot of Italian restaurants nearby on Hanover St. We especially liked Riccardo's on Quincy St.

Reviews.Title: “Boston harbour heaven”
Reviews.Author: nautilus01
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight before a business meeting, and loved it. Gorgeous, massive and comfortable bed, nice desk area, great view over the harbour. Very quiet and peaceful. Bathroom massive, clean and lovely. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room service dinner of burger was massive and very tasty, including fantastic Boston baked beans. Breakfast was the only let down: mostly cold by the time it arrived, and I found the addition of a cold boiled carrot on the plate sort of put me off the bacon and eggs. I'll be sure to order definitely next time. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TJP13
Reviews.Content: I visited Boston for a "girls" weekend getaway with my best friend and our Mothers. This was a perfect hotel for us to stay in. The rooms are very spacious, clean, comfortable and have a lovely modern decor. This hotel pays attention to detail - you can request to have their standard down pillows or a foam pillow. I even enjoyed the luxury type toiletries (Miller Harris brand). We unfortunately experienced the public water line breaking while we were in Boston. It was very hot (in the 90's) and there was no public water. We couldn't even brush our teeth. This was very inconvenient, but we found that our hotel was very accommodating. They let us know what happened right away and provided an abundance of bottled water for each guest. The restaurant had great food and they even opened 15 minutes early one morning when they saw us waiting to get breakfast. The staff was extremely kind and helpful with tourist info and were very accommodating during this strange "water-shortage" in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a secluded location.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel025
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Battery Wharf is a fantastic hotel in a quiet and secluded location within walking distance from the North End (just two blocks from great Italian restaurants). My wife and I stayed there for three nights and had a great time there. Our room faced the ocean and was quite big and very well appointed. service was extraordinary. It was clearly worth the money as we had a reasonable rate through the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great attention to detail, a good location, but room location poor.”
Reviews.Author: Niffermc
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel one night for business. It had everything I needed plus more. It was completely wired for computers, recharging batteries, etc. It was a very good business hotel. I liked the location. There were all kinds of restaurants and shops. It was a very charming area. The hotel is on the water and I took the Rowes Wharf Taxi to the hotel. The hotel will give instuctions as to how to do that. It was easy, more fun and less expensive than taking a cab. On the down side, the location of my room was poor. I was on the second floor by the entrance to the hotel. I like leaving drapes open for light during the day, but I was so close to the cars driving up to the hotel, that I felt like I was on the street. It was a very public room; number 4202. Also, there were a lot of outside hotel lights that were very bright and close to my windows. One other odd thing, the speakers for the tv were in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: cynthiap766
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say what a nice hotel this is. Although it's a bit out of the way the hotel and service by far make up for it. The staff simpley were perfect. The best way to arrive is by water taxi. We bought a round trip for only $17.00 from Rowes Wharf Water Taxi. These folks were wonderful too! We wanted to see a bit of the harbor and at no additional charge they gave us a nice little tour. I'll will be back to Boston and will be staying at the Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the North End”
Reviews.Author: lbznyc603
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, so comfortable with amazing amenities. Enjoyed the nespresso machine in the room & the close proximity to the north end's great restaurants. I liked how it was removed from the hustle and bustle of the heart of the city, but it was still close enough to cab to all the hot spots within ten minutes, or take a twenty minute stroll. Would highly recommend this hotel and am looking forward to staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be surprised”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlNashville
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the Fairmont? Fantastic? Unbelievable? Not to be missed? All of the above? The room was amazing. The service is unmatched in my experience. Unfortunately, staying at this hotel may have spoiled me for anything less. I don't know how I'll be able to handle being treated like a "normal" traveler after this. I wish I had something bad to say to make it a little more believable, but I just don't. There are several upper-end hotels in Boston and, I'm sure, comparable service. However, I don't think I will ever find out because I will stay here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of luxury and a bathroom to die for”
Reviews.Author: Twang1964
Reviews.Content: Just back from Boston Fairmont Battery Wharf and what a beautiful hotel it is too. From the moment we arrived at the jetty having caught the Water Taxi from the airport to when we left it was our little piece of heaven. The walk through (yes through) wardrobes allow access from either side meaning you can get to your clothes from the bathroom or the room, very clever and a nice touch. The bathroom is 5 star with with a great shower and top end fittings. The rooms are done in a stylish modern manner and our room also had a view across the harbour. If I have a complaint then charging for wifi which is free in by far lesser hotels does seem a bit odd. However, you will find Starbucks just up the road and for the price of a Latte you can catch up on your emails or Skype your friends back home to your hearts content.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dansun82
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful weekend stay at the Battery Wharf Gold Building. Having easy access to drinks and breakfast every morning along with dessert at night and evening canapes was a real treat. The staff was very nice and helpful. I particularly enjoyed the layout of the room and the comfortable bed. I felt like I could sleep for days. Another win for fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel by the Wharf”
Reviews.Author: drewheelin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after it recently opened in October 2009 and found this hotel to be much better than its "sister", the Copley Plaza. What's great about this hotel is its location and it's accessible by the water taxi--it stops just outside of the hotel! Like the other Fairmont facilities I stayed in, I also experienced the friendly staff here, which made my stay experience that more satisfying. Room was comfortable, quiet, spacious, and has all the amenities I expected. Wi-fi was great and free...if you're a Presidents Club member. Location wise, Paul Revere House, Old North Church, and New England aquarium are all within short walking distance. And the restaurants, oh, wow, there are lots to choose from nearby. If you're looking for a place to stay in the North End, close to tourist attractions, the wharf, eating places, and don't mind splurging a little, I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: galwaygirla
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 2 girlfriends on a Saturday night- this was the cheapest room on hotels.com! A good start! We arrived early so our room wasn't ready. 10 out of 10 marks to Lori, the receptionist- the best receptionsit I've ever come across- and I manage a hotel myself! Nice friendly welcome, we came back later that day after exploring Boston- our room was beautiful! Two huge double beds, beautiful bathroom , luxury toileteries, big lcd tv, great mini bar, seaview. Only downside is you had to pay $15.99 for a days internet access! We were in the US for 2 weeks and this was by far the best hotel we stayed in, also the cheapest!

Reviews.Title: “Just a perfect hotel...”
Reviews.Author: skljajic
Reviews.Content: I've read many great reviews about this Fairmont hotel and have to say they were right! This hotel is spot on on everything. Helpful staff, wonderful and squeaky clean rooms, nice location. Check in and check out went very smooth, being a member of Presidents Club gives few niceties, internet in room was free and fast. This is a wonderful hotel for my business travel but would use it as well for travel with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Battery Wharf - enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: powertravelers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely and located conveniently in the north end for sight seeing and dining. We particularly enjoyed walking to numerous destinations (aquarium, quincy market, uss constitution, and the north end restaurants). It is not particularly near a subway station so walking and taxi are your best bets. The hotel and parking are expensive but we got a pretty good deal on travelzoo.

Reviews.Title: “Brillian staff at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheila2907
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with husband and adult son and was very impressed with this hotel. The staff are definately a selling point in this hotel as they were superb from the moment we checked in to the moment we left again. Chris who is part of the restaurant staff was absolutely wonderful, very professional, hard working and couldnt do enough for us as well as knowing a lot about the area. This can also be said about another staff member (sorry cant remember her name) but she called us 'her little family' and really took care of us whilst we passed some time in the 'living room' where we took refuge from the heat outside most late afternoons and had some cocktails and nibbles as we did so. She was wonderful. We took the water-taxi from the airport to the hotel and this was very efficient and easily navigated and would definately recommend as the easiest and smoothest way to travel. If there was a downside and this is very small it would be that if you needed large towels or anything else you had to ask as it was not always available in the room but saying that in asking nothing was a problem as was delivered to the room promptly. I had also spoken with a few people who had been upgraded to the Gold building as a matter of course and who were not a gold member and as we were three adults it would have been good to have more space available to us but we booked through Expedia as a last minute booking and have heard that unless you book directly with the hotel then these 'specials' are not likely to happen.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: gks
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Boston, I had the absolute pleasure of staying at this property. I had booked through Fairmonts Central Reservations but later called the hotel directly to ask a question. I am thrilled I made that call. A Fairmont Gold representative, Ishan, answered. After chatting and gaining more information I chose to upgrade to the "Gold" building, a wonderful decision. Upon check-in we were escorted to the separate building, by a very knowledgeable and friendly staff member. Check in was seamless, and our room was a lovely corner room. I had booked a harbor view in the main building, and while this room did indeed have an appealing view, it's not harbor front. Nonetheless, the room, decor, and bathroom, were all lovely. The linens were top quality and beds were very comfortable. The recliner might be the most comfortable chair I've ever sat in. The large (functioning) windows were delightful and made the already spacious room that much more enjoyable. A flat screen, coffee/espresso machine, well stocked mini-bar, and ample seating, were also enjoyed. Over the weekend we took great advantage of the lounge and it's patio area. The meals/snacks and drinks were all top notch and the entire area was spotless and meticulously maintained by the gold staff members. Although we found later that the hotel was full, the lounge was never crowded and the offerings were creative and plentiful. In closing I will say what made the stay at the Fairmont truly memorable was the staff. Ishan Johnson is a gem. Attentive, professional, caring and very concerned with his guests comfort and happiness. Ishan, Johnathan Greenberg, and indeed all the staff we had the pleasure of dealing with were beyond compare. Certainly when we return to Boston, this will be our only choice for accommodations. Pros: Location, location, location! The close proximity to ample attractions and restaurants made it perfect for a base point. Lovely harbor front location, and very short ride to/from the airport. Decor, comfort and amenities. First class. Staff, simply beyond compare! Cons: No bedside alarm clock nor i-pod docking station. A trivial complaint and almost not worth mentioning. The flat screen is fixed and wall mounted, making it difficult to view from the bed(s). Again, trivial...except when you're arguing over who gets to sit in the incredible recliner!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, overall very good experience”
Reviews.Author: dman-and-teamgreen
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few nights while in Boston. Found the location good - walking distance to the Wharfs, Quincy Market, Hanover st and Boston Common, easy commute to Harvard, Boylston St/Commonwealth Ave and Fenway Park. Played the upgrade card and for a small additional cost got a lovely suite. Recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive”
Reviews.Author: anniejean
Reviews.Content: My sister, myself and my 10 yr old daughter booked a room at the Fairmont Battery Wharf for an overnight stay to see Boston. When we got there, the person at the desk told us we had been upgraded to a suite in the Fairmont Gold building, across the street. Our jaws dropped when we saw our suite. Two bathrooms, two big-screen t.v.s, and access to the concierge lounge with free breakfast. What a wonderful experience it was. The staff was helpful and always smiling, and the accomodations were spotless and comfortable. Our stay in Boston was a memorable one, and we will be recommending this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “a piece of paradise in the big city”
Reviews.Author: travsavvy
Reviews.Content: went for a waterfront experience including outside dining but unfortunately had rain for dinner; however later in evening and next morning were beautiful and sitting/walking by the water was fantastic; watching the boats go by, including the crazy party boats (sorry for the million dollar condos having to bear that noise) was spectacular. It was hard to believe one was in Boston and yet it felt like a far off vacation destination (we live in Massachusetts and usually spend an over- night in the city proper). We stayed in a gold signature waterfront room and it was perfect! The service was exceptional, the room spotless and very comfortable; oddly though, there were many lights in the room but none had a dimming feature and we missed that. The "gold" services were unlike any we have experienced and everyone should try it at least once; those staff are dedicated to making one's stay as pleasant as possible. We ate at Sensing, albeit inside (disappointingly), and the food was excellent if not simple. The basic Martinis that we drank were lovely if not for the $15 dollar each charge!!! We spend less on these in Back Bay. The walk to North End for gelato was a bonus. All in all, would definitely stay here again if we got a good deal and needed to pretend we were far far away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find for Last Minute Trip”
Reviews.Author: GStrbk
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on TA and was happy to discover the previous guests weren't exaggerating. Great location, great staff, great recommendations and lovely room. Booked a King Harbor-view room thru Expedia and almost was placed in a lesser room...was told that bookings not done directly through the hotel aren't always as advertised. Happily, an acceptable room, as advertised, was available even though the hotel was pretty well booked for the picture-perfect weekend. Breakfast at Sensing was good, although a little pricey. Our own carafe of delicious Starbucks coffee on the table is always a plus for us! Everything about our 2-night stay was lovely, but we especially enjoyed the convenience of taking the water taxi directly from Logan to the hotel. The staff booked our return trip (get the r/t ticket and save $3 each) and we were amazed at how easily we came and left a perfect Boston weekend. Like another TA member, would have loved a jacuzzi to soak our weary bones in after a long day of sightseeing. Will happily return to this beautiful city and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Valentine's weekend”
Reviews.Author: Wookai
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a room in this hotel for two nights on the Valentine's weekend. Everything was perfect, the room huge, the beds very (very) comfortable, the bathroom had both a bath tub and a shower, and the view was nice, even if we were on a lower level. We paid a very good price (less than 50% the usual price) and were afraid we'd get a room in the basement or something, but no, we got the full thing. The only problem we got is that the valet parking nearly lost our car, it took them 30 minutes to get it when we left. Except that, everything was as expected, or better.

Reviews.Title: “Delight on the Harbor with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Travelers804
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Battery Wharf was a delightful place to stay while in Boston. We loved the option to take the water taxi from the airport, across the harbor, and right to the dock. The staff provided a smooth checkin and walked us to our room to highlight the amenities. The bedding and mattress was unbeatable, such a cozy night's sleep. The nespresso machine in the room was a bonus. The coffee is excellent! The bathroom felt spa like and the towels and bathrobes were plush. Breakfast in the restaurant was good, but nothing amazing. The hotel was in a great location for sightseeing. We walked to many main sights with the help of complimentary maps and directions from the hotel staff. We hoped they had a hot tub to relax in at the end of the day. Apparently this is in the works for 2011. The only disappointment was that they did not have a room available for us to freshen up in after a day of sightseeing in Boston, prior to boarding a cross country flight. Overall, we loved our stay at the Fairmont and would happily stay here again when we return to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would return”
Reviews.Author: Becauseican79
Reviews.Content: The good: The rooms are beautiful. The location is perfect. The staff was extremely helpful. The bad: Our room was located directly across from housekeeping. If you step off the elevator and your room is the first door in the hallway- ask to be moved. We didn't find this out until our first morning when we were woken up as the housekeepers started their day. The "Please Make up Room" button also appears to be broken in this room or we may have switched from "Do Not Disturb" to "Please Make Up Room" too late in the day. We came back to a dirty room. When we called the front desk to ask for towels they were very concerned about our room not being cleaned and offerend to send someone up, but by then we were tired and wanted to relax. They did try to make the situation right. Parking was $42 a night which in my opinion is high.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay on the harbour”
Reviews.Author: RulyTruly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Battery Wharf in mid-June for 5 nights, and were so pleased with our choice of hotel. The location was great: we loved being able to go for morning runs along the harbor foreshore or wander the lively Italian Northend neighborhood in the evening, eating a gelato. Our room was a beautiful, king bed harbor suite with an enormous bathroom with a great shower. The furnishings were extremely comfortable and the bed blissful. There was sometimes a bit of noise of a morning from the coastguard working on their boats. Weâ€™d joined the Presidents Club before our stay, so we had access to great, free wi-fi. For us the service at the Fairmont Battery Wharf was the best of the hotels we stayed at in our month long US trip. Annette at the front desk, with graciousness and warmth, gave us great restaurant recommendations, quickly got us good tickets to the Boston Red Sox and arranged for a parcel to be delivered back to Australia. She was outstanding. We had our best Boston dinner at Sensing (the hotel restaurant) â€“ the service, food and wine were all excellent. We also enjoyed cocktails on the terrace, overlooking the harbor. An excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location/Ultra modern!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: thestewarts_10
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel!!!! We all agreed that the public washrooms in the hotel were the best we've EVER seen. The hotel is built on the Wharf next to the Boston Base where you can admire the Coast Guard Ships. The restaurant Sensing is phenomenal!!! The servers are all mature,professional and attentive. The food is fantastic at an unbelievable price. This hotel is centrally located to everything. You really don't need to worry about where to "PAHK THE CAH"!!! The Valet service is very efficient and quick. The Front Desk staff were extremely friendly and knowledgeable in everything Boston. The coffee machine in the room is an espresso machine. NICE TOUCH!!!! My only complaint with this hotel was the duvet on our beds were heavier than we're used to. Too hot and uncomfortable but I'm sure if we had called down they have lighter summer weight duvets.(I have to mention that we were there in the heat wave as well). All in all though amazing hotel very modern and clean with a great restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “There is not a better hotel in Boston than this one”
Reviews.Author: winewithdinner
Reviews.Content: This Fairmont is refined luxury, the smaller buildings were perfect and the North End is 2 minutes away. You are on the water and the feeling is one of true relaxation and comfort. Every staff person was awesome, the room was huge, and the gold concierges were the best. The intimacy of a smaller rather than a convention big hotel, is stunningly refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and first class service - an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: MancMouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights during the Easter holidays. Chose the hotel because of the great reviews on Trip Advisor and we weren't disappointed. A good quiet location - a bit of a walk to the city centre but fine with us, and ideally located for the restaurants and bars of the Italian North End. We'd requested connecting rooms but these weren't available on the first night and we stayed in rooms in the building opposite the main hotel. However we were subsequently moved to spacious connecting rooms in the main building which were very well appointed in contemporary style with lovely big bathrooms, nice toiletries , large TVs and a good coffee maker. Breakfasts were fantastic and the service was superb - the staff made a special effort with our children which was really impressive . There are so many dining options in Boston but we had dinner once in the hotel restaurant, Sensing, which was pricey but delicious. Room service was a big hit with our daughters. The front desk staff were also very attentive and quickly located a shoe and bag repairer in Providence Street who did an amazing job of fixing my handbag. We look forward to returning to the Fairmont and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect North End Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stamfordtraveler72
Reviews.Content: Took the train up from NYC for the weekend to meet up with family in Boston. The hotel had a good weekend rate and much of our time was going to be spent in the North End eating and hanging out while doing some light sightseeing. The hotel was less than a $10 cab ride from the train station and within about a 10/15 minute walk from the Haymarket T-stop. Stayed in building across from the main building with the lobby. Had a king bed and huge bathroom with lots of great amenities, including a very good espresso maker. Room had a very modern feel to it, which worked, and was very quiet with a comfy bed with lots of storage for clothes and luggage. The doorman was friendly and front-desk staff was helpful. If your stay in Boston centers around the North End, this is the place for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Terrible location”
Reviews.Author: AFC048
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont for my b'day and I was disappointed with a number of things. Although the hotel is to be considered a 5 star, I'd give it low 4. The room was definitely beautiful, but ... the front desk staff was rude both the evening and morning crew. The gym is not in the same building. There two two buildings of hotels room, making it inconvenient to go to the lobby or restaurant, esp in the winter. The parking as at least $30 a night in the area, which due to the location is way over priced. However you are subject to drive since the closed subway is at least 30minute walk or more (plus your luggage). As a travel agent, I would highly recommend looking into the Intercon or Harborside Hotel which is still on the water but a much much better location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gizmocub
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week back in January. The hotel was clean and very contemporary and the staff friendly and helpful (the first room we were given had no room safe but as soon as I pointed out that we needed one they gave us a different room) . The room was clean and spacious with a large bathroom with separate walk in shower. The bed was comfy and we had a great harbour view. The location was perfect being a short walk away from the bars and restaurants of the North End but with the benefit of the hotel being quiet at night, essential as I am a light sleeper. I had found a rate online that included breakfast which turned out to be very good value. The blueberry pancakes were fantastic! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel! Incredible service!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Ostrich
Reviews.Content: This amazing hotel made our trip. We had incredible service offered by the staff: you can see right away that this hotel is extremely well-managed. Our room was roomy, luxurious, comfortable and very clean: they paid attention to details (ex: marble shower, LCD flat screen TV, ipod docking, etc.). Plus, this hotel is very nicely located in the North end of downtown Boston, near many italian restaurants, downtown activities, the Freedom trail and many more. If you want a nice get-away, without worries, this hotel and the staff will make sure you have a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: shopkitten
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, the room was amazing 5* quality, the biggest bed ever, luxury bathroom, excellent coffee machine. The room service was brilliant and reasonable for this quality of hotel. 2 very minor negatives (however donâ€™t let them put you off!) 1â€“ They tried to sell us an upgrade as we were checking in. Always find that a bit pushy and it makes you worry about the quality of the room you have. Donâ€™t be tempted to upgrade, the quality of the standard room is amazing! 2-It is not well located for using public transport. It is not convenient for the underground. Be prepared to use taxis and walk. We really enjoyed the â€˜longishâ€™ walk into town. That said the hotel is in the heart of the fashionable/classy North End, so there are lots of lovely bars and restaurants on your door step. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: lagunatravel
Reviews.Content: Over the years we have stayed in many hotels in the area, but the Fairmont Battery Wharf is absolutely the best. The location overlooking the water is restful with lovely views. It is quieter than staying in town with pathways to walk around a very pleasant neighborhood with restaurants and shops and easy access into the city. The hotel is contemporary and feels small and personal with a very helpful, considerate staff and a great casual restaurant/bar. Our room was very close to the water with windows that opened to let in the wonderful breezes. In fact, our room was so comfortable and well appointed that I did not want to leave. This will be our home when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful comfortable hotel, but overpriced and location not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: TeeeTeee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. Although it was a fantastic 3 nights in a beautiful, spacious, clean, and comfortable room (and a great view!) with some of the best service I have had anywhere, it still was quite a distance from the downtown business area and, therefore, quite expensive to taxi back and forth and quite a ways to walk. I also had some difficulty regulating the temperature in my room, but it wasn't awful. I am very picky when it comes to the cleanliness of hotel rooms and this was certainly top notch, one of the best I have EVER been in. Flat screen tv, in room expresso/coffee machine, massage shower, VERY large bathroom area, and the nice comfy chair in the room were all very much enjoyed. However, I did have a problem with billing/charges on my account. My room was suppose to be 100% paid by the company I was doing business and they had arranged the hotel for me and there name, billing info. etc. was all part of the check-in. But, of course, I had to give a credit card at check-in just in case for "extras". Well, when I checked out, I left with "everything is taken care of" and knowing nothing should be put on my acccount. I ended up with a charge on my account (that shouldn't have been there!) and it took over a week a 4 phone calls before it finally was credited back. They were very polite and apologetic on the phone, but it still took 4 calls before it was removed! Although I had a wonderful stay and it was probably one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at, I would never pay that much myself for a hotel room. In other words, since it was paid for me, it was fantastic, but paying out of my own pocket, I can find wonderful hotels that I would be just as comfortable in for more than half the price!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful- Wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: BUparents
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this property was great! The room itself and bathroom were spacious and clean with a great view of the harbor. We were worried about the location at first, being a bit farther from BU than the Copley Plaza, but our GPS helped out when we had to drive and the walk through the North End to the "T" (which makes the Downtown convenient) is always entertaining! And the proximity to Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market, the interesting HarborWalk and the North End is a plus. The service provided by the staff is excellent. Friendly, courteous and helpful, they made us feel as we were coming home each evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall”
Reviews.Author: moneytree88
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Upon entering the hotel, I noticed that its not your usual grand and traditional Fairmont hotels but more on the contemporary style. Everything looked very clean and new. We stayed in the bldg across the main bldg. I little disappointing to see there is no accessible reception right in our bldg. We got their std room and the room size is just right for two persons. Cleanliness - everything was so clean esp the washrooms. Service - our housekeeper arranged all our personal toiletries which was very much appreciated; however, she failed to refill the teabags we loved on the first night of our stay....didn't refill it on 3rd night as well (reason why Im giving them 4 stars) Location - very convenient. Just took a 10 min water taxi fr the airport and we get dropped off right at our hotel's wharf. There are also a lot nice restaurants just a couple of streets away, such as in Hanover and Salem St. But the nearest subway station is a bit of a walk... about 10 -15 min. Value - worth our money. .. got a discount from priceline! Sleep Quality - bed was very very comfortable, sheets are perfect and clean. No yucky quilted covers on top of bed that usually don't get washed that often in most hotels. Loved it. Will come back if given the chance to visit Boston again and if we get the same discounted price from priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service - Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Wellingtonbound
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Fairmont for 3 nights in May. Fantastic hotel, very clean but what really sets it apart is the service. The staff are sensational! They really go out of their way to make you feel special. First class all the way! If we have any complaint, it would be the lack of recreational facilities (i.e. an indoor/outdoor pool). We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and service I've had in years!”
Reviews.Author: Tripgoer101
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were actually shown to our rooms. I booked through Last Minute Travel and they gave us a nice side view of the harbor which meant we actually saw the water and airplanes taking off across the river. The water shuttle was very convenient and we pulled right up to our hotel. The rooms were spotless and the bathroom large. The large flat-screen TV was an added bonus. There is an extremely comfortable chair in the room as well for business travelers. I'm very picky about noises and smells in hotels and the Fairmont had none of that. It was nice and quiet and peaceful. I took a nap almost every other day. The upside to this hotel is being near the North End where it's safe and has great food. Be prepared to eat your way through the North End and love the nightlife on the weekends. There are few downsides to this hotel (but these are easily worked around): First, parking is very expensive. Solve this by parking down the street where prices are less in other lots. Next, this hotel is not very close to the public transportation, however it only takes about 15 minutes to walk there. So, if you're like most Americans you need the exercise anyhow. And last, the bathroom and shower are semi-see through or all the way see through, so if you are taking a family/children along then just close the door that separates the bathroom from the rest of the room. Service was excellent. The breakfast seemed overpriced so we walked 2 blocks down and had a lovely breakfast at Anthony's Restaurant each morning. I'd stay here in a heartbeat if we go back again! It made our trip even better to have a place to come back to each night that was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BostonBeachgirl32
Reviews.Content: I decided for my boyfriends birthday to go away for the night to Boston. I had never been to this hotel and decided to try it out, I got a rate of $199 with free parking and I thought that was great! All the staff was GREAT. We walked to L'Osteria for dinner (which was about a 7 minute walk) the food was amazing and was a very reasonable price. Since checkout was at noon we simply left our car in the valet (which you can do till 5 pm) and the hotel just held on our bags. We walked to the aquarium (a 10 minute way) and then went over to Quincy Market. I felt this hotel was in the perfect location - we could walk to everything we needed. I would highly recommend this hotel to EVERYONE and I can't wait to come visit again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with best/ worst Location”
Reviews.Author: ibelvis
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides fantastic service from the check in, door men, house keeping..... I'm a Four Season fan and this hotel exceeded my expectations. The location is: Great - walk to North End and all Italian restaurants and pastries, Boston Gardens and Fanuiel hall. You can take a water taxi to the hotel dock. Bad - no access to trains, long taxi rides to external areas, taxi's are not lined up to serve the hotel, but I never waited more than 2 minutes for a cab. Pulling on my Four Season experience, this hotel reminds me of FS Las Vegas/ San Francisco/ Chicago - you have access to entertainment/energy, but you hotel is a little removed,.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: suebhon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a chance to head to Boston for a couple of nights without children. I wanted to stay someplace nice, but not break the bank. Got a good rate for the Fairmont Battery Wharf through travelzoo and upgraded to a harbor view room. We loved the hotel--very quiet and serene. The room was new, modern and very comfortable--loved the big leather lounge chair, the plush bed and linens, the beautiful bathroom with rain shower. Join the Fairmont club in advance of your stay and you get free internet. We had very good breakfasts in the restaurant. Loved the location--I went running by the water in the morning and enjoyed cannolli and espresso in the North End in the afternoon. We also had a delicious dinner at Lucca in the North End. I usually stay in Back Bay when in Boston and that might be more convenient for business, but I would definitely return to Fairmont Battery Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Stay in Boston EVER”
Reviews.Author: Smitten
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from running the Boston Marathon. Most of my friends stayed downtown near Copley which I have done in the past until I discovered this hotel last year simply by just walking by. The staff at the Fairmont Battery Wharf in every department are so amazing - no task or request is too great and is done with such willingness. The rooms are large and spotless and so modern, The linens on the bed are to die for. Makes sleeping a real luxury. Closet space - you could bring your wardrobe from home and fit it all in. I had just a regular room. When you check in they make sure all your requirements are met. They had on Sunday and Monday a Grab and Go breakfast for runners starting at 5:30am - it was top notch and as a runner you could not have asked for more nutritional food - if you were in a hurry they had bags and cutlery so you could eat on the run so to speak. The dining room unfortunately I was only able to eat a sit down breakfast days prior to the race but from what I hear I really missed out on the dinner menu. Next year for sure- I have already made my reservation for next April. If you are attending a Celtics or Bruins game you can walk - 10 minutes away. If you need the underground there are two stops I prefer the wharf walk cause you pass a Starbucks and you get to walk along the water the whole time. Very close to all those great Italian restaurants in the North End - and very close to Quincy Market - I must mention that while during my stay I became extremely sick with Sinusitus and needed a Doctor. I phoned the reception at 1AM on Sunday and was given the best treatment by the staff- by 7:30AM I was all fixed up with a Dr and given a prescription at CVS on Bolyston Street which I picked up that morning. Without the help and knowledge of the staff at the Fairmont Battery Wharf as who to turn to I may have had to withdraw from the Marathon - I am so very grateful for their assistance and it is very comforting to know that they have their guests best interests truly at heart. Thank You so much. There is no better place to stay in Boston in my opinion. I also had a great race.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new”
Reviews.Author: JackFlynn
Reviews.Content: Very new,very clean,great service,very comfortable. Even though we got a great deal on priceline,they gave us a free room upgrade. This hotel is also in a great location, in Boston's north end. Parking is valet only and costs $42. There is almost no overnight parking in the north end for non residents, so be prepared to leave the car with the valet. My only complaint would be the $16.95 charge for Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a highlight on our trip to Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Ohmiss1
Reviews.Content: We were so pleasantly surprised by our stay here! It was our first time to Boston as a family, so we weren't sure where to stay. The location was perfect - we could walk to the arena for the Celtics game, walk to all the great restaurants and pastry shops in the North End, walk the Freedom Trail. The service was one of the best we've had, it's right up there. Debbie at the Front Desk and Chris (doing just about every job imaginable) were standouts. They couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating to our every need. This is great location if you're coming to Boston. We upgraded to the suite on the first floor, it was just amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ending;-)”
Reviews.Author: Litsa
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early off a shuttle from LGA so knew we'd have a wait for a room! The cab pulled up to the property's 'main' building..I assumed..since I later found out that there are a number of 'buildings' that make up this Hotel! Checked in small roller luggage and took off..returning a bit past noontime to find out that our room was in the 'other' building from where we left our overnighter...we were led to the other building and told it would be about another hour which was not a problem since we didn't have lunch..with Emily at the helm, felt assured at this point! Gracious and empathetic at our early morning arrival, she led us into a beautiful living/lounge area in the dedicated 'Gold' building..old world charm w/all the modern conveniences..as was our room! There is a Happy Hour of sorts that includes more fare than a full course meal..which we totally utilized (they had a fish soup w/saffron that particular night that was out of this world)..needless to say, one can feast here and look no futher! Honor system with only alcohol being charged at reasonable rates! There is an additional 'dessert' hour later on around 9p which I made a point to avoid;-)) Kudos to the staff here..between Emily and Dennis, can't imagine any request hard-pressed to be met! When I booked on--line, had no idea of all the varios 'buildings', so was grateful to be staying in the Gold;-) Hands down top-notch service that certainly left some weary travellers happy campers at the end of the day..personal thanks to both for their exceptional service! They make it worth a return visit;-) Had a wonderful stay and totally enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: “Six Stars for Service! A Profesional”
Reviews.Author: loufatpops
Reviews.Content: Seeing as we were not a Hotelier's ideal customers, (8 guys in a Bachelor party) I was skeptical of how we were going to be treated, especially being a frequent visitor to the Fairmont Chain. Instead of getting the cold shoulder, as I have in other Fairmont hotels in the past; the staff at the Battery Wharf were nothing short of spectacular! For starters, the personal tour of the room and amenities along with the knowledge of the local food and Bar scene was great. This is standard... What they did that was exceptional is - set us up a personal place in the lobby to have drinks after the bar so that we didnt disrupt any of our neighbors. - Call a Pub when one of the boys left his wallet at the bar - Ordered and picked up pizza at a local joint at 2 am - bought us a round of drinks I should mention, this is not a "party hotel" like my review would sound, but they understood our groups special needs for this weekend, and they did an amazing job catoring to them. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “all very very good-staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: bikeboy58
Reviews.Content: everything was very good-staff helpful+friendly-nice harbor view

Reviews.Title: “Loved the area of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelinggirl_7
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel made you feel a little disconnected due to the fact that there are three different buildings. I loved the hotel and the staff, but the only draw back was you felt you were in a apartment building. I think if they could make you feel like you are staying in a hotel building it would be better. I loved the area and was glad we made the choice. We visited Copley Square and found it to be way to noisy. The staff by far made up for any of the draw backs. We had a few problems with house keeping, but they quickly resolved any problems. Beautiful room and bathroom and would definately stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent, if a little quirky”
Reviews.Author: Thedoctorislistening
Reviews.Content: I stayed just after the hotel opened. It's located between the Italian quarter and the sea, which is great, albeit a little way from Boston centre. I was offered a complimentary upgrade to the Gold building, with full concierge service. This was excellent - the complimentary breakfast and supper were delightful, varied and exquisitely presented. The honour bar felt like we were being respected, and treated like grown-ups, and the selction of wines was superb, and reasonably priced. The staff could also not have been more helpful, being knowledgeable, friendly, respectful without being too in your face. The guest lounge was a lovely extra, and felt just like my home living room would, if I could have a Butler 24/7. The books about the locale, and the DVDs to borrow (some filmed in Boston) were a lovely touch The downside was that I was on fold-down sofa-bed, as my room was designed as a sitting room in a suite. It wasn't that comfortable. They won't catch me like that again! I accept that it was a free upgrade, though, and I could have declined. The other down-side - no pool. I'm going back in the next few days, and can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mamige
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic!!!! Is so elegant and cozy at the same time. The service in the front desk is great, everybody tried to help me in all my needs. The room is very big, and have the most comfortable bed that i ever sleep. The bathroom is huge and well designed. The service is perfect. Everything is super clean from the rooms to the lobby, everything was really perfect. I was afraid of the locaction because i was used to stay in the copley place area, but the hotel is located in a very beatifull area, near the water. I really loved this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cold service on a cold gray weekend.”
Reviews.Author: sothshoretravelers
Reviews.Content: I booked a night in a deluxe room for my husband's 50th figuring the location was handy the North End and our restaurant of choice. I booked on their website and requested a good view and nice room to celebrate his big birthday. I don't think my request was ever read, as it was not acknowledged at the desk. The hotel was not very booked, and we had an adequate view but tthe staff easily could have given us an unobstructed water view on a floor higher than 2 with the number of people staying at the hotel.
