It was difficult to request another room because the front desk person takes you to the room in another building and did not say anything about the room to us at the desk. And who wants a hassle?- you pay Fairmont prices to not be hassled. The valet staff did not open my car door, and we were offerred a luggage cart, but carried our own small overnight bags- not what one expects from a Fairmont. There were a few newspapers in front of a few rooms in the morning, but the hotel was pretty empty. We both felt were intruding on the help. The room was modern and comfortable, and I wanted to give a 3 star service rating, but my husband read this and said even 2 stars was too high for the service level. He travels frequently, and reccommonds hotels to his colleages that stay in Boston, and we would never reccommend the Fairmont Battery Wharf. There are lots of nice hotels in Boston with great service. Stay at the Copley Fairmont if you want a Fairmont even if it means taking a cab or try one of the other modern hotels. I don't think this hotel will be a Fairmont for long.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great Gold Service”
Reviews.Author: cliffandjules
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the gold building and, whilst i agree that it is less favourably located than the main hotel, the security offered as a result of access to this block is really top notch and the personal service superb. I agree with the review by neilma below regaring the service provided by Emily, she really did go out of her way to help us enjoy Boston suggesting and booking restaurants and attractions. Alex was also excellent. We too were allocated a room on the top floor (as requested) with a balcony overlooking the harbour. A picture is attached of the view. (Great views from every window including the bathroom!!) Regarding some of the comments on the range complimentary breakfast and evening snacks - I feel what was provided is perfectly adequate as these are clearly not intended to be a replacement for a full blown dining experience! We made use of the evening snacks on our night of arrival which were perfect for what we needed after a long journey, together with the excellently stocked "honesty" bar. We found our breakfast each morning to be just what we were looking for in Boston (we were travelling to new York after Boston and were saving our fab diner breakfasts for then!!) and we were alone nearly every time we visited. All day tea and Starbucks coffee were also a big bonus, which can be taken to the room also (good nespresso coffee maker in room too). Location was great, close to the huge number of Italian restaurants. We can also recommend Joe's on the waterfront just along from the hotel. Our experience was excellent if you are looking for good American fayre , with great steak and cocktails, good wines and truly great value and service (with superb views of the city and harbour)

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel, but don't bring a car!”
Reviews.Author: Annakatrina
Reviews.Content: I realize they're trying to make Fairmont Gold fancy, but the hotel seemed a little sad and threadbare. It's in a smaller building set back from the main hotel and farther away from the water. The complimentary food and drinks are sparse (the free continental breakfast was packed with people trying to elbow their way through the line for stale bagels). The internet, while free, was very slow, as was the cable connection on the t.v. Our room was small and very dark, and my side of the bed didn't have a night table. Picky, I know, but if a hotel is trying to sell itself as "luxury", the details count. On the bright side, the bathroom was wonderful, with a big, clean shower stall and amazing water pressure. Everyone who worked in the hotel was infallibly nice as well. Maybe I wouldn't be so critical if the valet service had not been such a hassle. We called for our car so we could make a performance we had tickets to, assuming the car would show up in ten minutes. After waiting outside for fifteen minutes, we asked the front desk to call the valet again. The valet told us they had brought out the car, waited for "over fifteen minutes" and then taken the car back to the garage! We had been waiting outside the entire time, and when they brought the car around again, it was driven past us and parked in front of the main hotel (even though we had repeatedly specified we were staying in the Gold building). After taking half an hour to get our car, we missed the performance we were trying to make. Worst of all, when we asked for the car again upon checkout, they parked it in the same place, out of eyesight of anyone waiting in the Gold hotel. To be fair, they erased the valet charges from our bill, but shouldn't part of luxury be great service?

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: examino
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night but it was a very pleasant one. The hotel is spotless and the room we had was excellent; spacious and well equipped. The hotel has nice views across the water and is ideally located in safe north end with loads of Italian restaurants two minutes walk (try Giacomo's, 355 Hanover St, it's a gem!). Staff we particularly helpful on checkout, where despite not having paid for breakfast, they insisted we have a bagel and freshly squeezed juice in the large reception area while we waited for the taxi (nice touch we thought). They also pro-actively checked loads of travel information for us and insisted we didn't have to lug our huge bags anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Gold Rooms/Building...”
Reviews.Author: andrew02459
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at all Fairmonts in North America with two exceptions over the last ten years. We stayed at this hotel last year, but our recent stay in the Gold "Building" (opened since our last stay) here is probably near the bottom of the list of "best Fairmont sites". The building is not near the water, so if you want views get a regular room not a Gold one. On arrival, we were stuck outside the Gold Building for almost 10 minutes as the door was locked, no one answered our knocks, no doorbell to be found. We finally found a valet housephone and got the receptionist at the other building. It appears there were two people who were supposed to be at the Gold Desk but no-one knew where they were. The room itself is standard for hotel rooms of this category: large flat screen tv, html-enabled Cisco phone (don't try for news or you'll end up with just html coding....), comfy bed. The lag-bolts were coming out of the shower wall for the hand-held spray..that surprised us. They might use these rooms for presentations/revenue sources as there was a large closed round electrical inlet protruding in the middle of the room which we kept tripping over(check out the picture we uploaded). The pre-dinner Gold offerings were minimal: one sealed bottle of red wine, no opener, two bottles with less than one ounce in them, and chunks of dry corned beef on a hot plate, small dishes of pasta salad. There was mustard, olives but no bread or napkins. Small cubes of cheese floated in olive oil. We initially thought they were going lean perhaps for a low booking night, but later were told they were full up, so not sure why so skimpy/sloppy on the lay-out. Morningtime, our shoes had been taken for cleaning overnight but never re-appeared and there was no answer at the Gold Concierge. The Receptionist in the main building said he'd find the shoes..called back in 20 min to say they would be ready soon but we were hungry and went down to breakfast in slippers. Unlike other Fairmonts, the Gold Lounge here only offers an "enhanced" Continental breakfast: oatmeal was the only hot option. They were out of orange juice (we were there at opening time) but the Concierge did find one glass for us. There were only a few croissants, some bagels...so much for the Italian bakeries near by. Our shoes, btw, arrived during the breakfast..about an hour after the Receptionist said they'd be ready. The location in the North End is good...no other hotel too close by..and you can watch Logan takeoffs and landings (just not from your Gold Building view). On other notes, the roses I had ordered over the phone from the Gold Concierge for my wife were delivered without the message card, and the Wifi signal was so weak it was mostly unusable esp considering the cumbermore multi-screen billing procedures to go through (even for alleged free Gold Wifi). The hotel has its own merit and of course the staff mostly seems to try and offer a good service but hard to give them credit when many such "merits" are expected in hotels of this category...I'd just point out here that unlike any other Gold offering in the Fairmont chain, I don't think it's worth it here.

Reviews.Title: “Valentines Day 2010”
Reviews.Author: Sarnie_M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for Valentines Day 2010. This hotel hands down is all about service. To start even before i booked the room i called an asked if i can view the rooms. The person on the phone was like "You sure can as long as no one is Staying in them". So about 12 midnight after work i stopped by an they showed me a few rooms with no problem. After that i was sold other hotels i had went to weren't trying to let me see the room. On the day of check-in i called to see if i could come in before the 3pm check-in time. Once again the person on the phone said "Let me check and see then said it will be fine". Upon going into the room the first word was WOW, it was just a beautiful room. Nice modern look to it not like other hotels older uglier room setups. There was a big king bed which was the softest i have ever sleep on. They also had a nice 42" LCD tv on the wall (Which also if you were watching tv you could also here it in the bathroom as well). There was a nice desk and a black leather chair. The view from the room was the Boston Harbor. An to top it off the price was very good. Any little thing you wanted seem like they were there to help. Cause my girlfriend and i went out to eat. She came back with a slice of cheese cake but it wouldn't fit in the mini bar refrigerator. I called the front desk an they had someone put a mini refrigerator in the room at no charge. So with all that being said i would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone looking to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “large, comforable, clean, modern, almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: ElaReviews
Reviews.Content: It is really excellent from almost all points of view. Large rooms (and we had a standard one), huge bed, clean and neat, large bathroom, all things in place and really feeling like a 5 star hotel. One thing that disturbed me was the AC starting the heat on and off, making a strange sound while on and not letting me sleep. It was like a whistle or a "pipe" but uncomfortable. As location, is close to the center but not quite so close. On a cold weather like ours it wasn't so pleasant to walk on the streets and the closest subway station is 10 min away, therefore we were most of the time calling cabs.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect city getaway”
Reviews.Author: jinggirl
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Fairmont Battery Wharf for our wedding in Boston. It was perfect, the staff were wonderful, we really enjoyed the location, views and proximity to Northend. Would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Recharge Your Battery!”
Reviews.Author: Landonsholiday
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont, Battery Wharf is a great hotel. Located across from the North End on the wharf next to the Coast Guard station, most rooms look out onto Boston Harbor. The result is an urban hotel that is not centrally located, but is quiet, even serene. Weâ€™ve been happy with every aspect of the hotel: the view of the Harbor is pretty; the kitchen is fantastic and room service has been delicious, prompt and pleasant; the burger at the bar is first rate; valet parking is efficient; housekeeping does a great job; and every interaction weâ€™ve had with a staff member has been positive. This is a great staff in a fantastic, new, urban hotel. Although we had an arguably nicer view of the harbor at the Boston Harbor Hotel, which is itself a great hotel, we think that the Fairmont is every bit its equal. Beds are plush and comfortable and the environment is very peaceful. Itâ€™s a great place for a lazy weekend, or as a base for walking the harbor walk or taking a water taxi or dining in the North End. Weâ€™ve been here three times since it opened and we've been been consistently pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Boston”
Reviews.Author: KevR1834
Reviews.Content: I was looking to book a hotel in Boston that also had dockage during the Tall Ships festival. The Fairmont Battery Wharf was wonderful because they took care of everything and the room rate was reasonable for a hotel of this class in Boston. I've stayed in Boston at the Westin Waterfront, Weston and Marriott in Copley, Interconn, etc. and this is by far the nicest hotel. For location, this hotel is in the heart of the North End right on the harbor. If you get a harbor view, or are lucky enough to get one of the suites at the end of the hotel, the sunrise is amazing and it has an incredible ambiance. I would definitely stay here again. The hotel itself is extremely clean, brand new, and everything you'd expect from a Fairmont. The staff was incredibly nice and very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start the New Year”
Reviews.Author: ackelley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for New Years Eve with my family. My husband & I have stayed at all the hotels on the Boston Waterfront including the Long Wharf Marriott, Intercontinental and the Boston Harbor Hotel and I can say that this was probably my favorite. The service was great. The location is a bit out of the way, but we enjoyed the walk. The hotel has a very intimate feel. The decor is amazing. The rooms were alittle small for our family of 4, but ok for one night. The kids loved the room amenities and the fitness center. I thought the speaker system in the bathroom was nice! My husband thought that the hotel was very well appointed. The hotel is on the harbor walk and would recommend that for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but Fairmont customer service response to smokers burnt us on our stay”
Reviews.Author: NYE2009Boston
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the good. Rooms are wonderful. Espresso machine in the room...yes! My technologically savvy husband was very impressed with all the "gadgets." We stayed in the hotel on New Year's Eve. We booked a group of rooms and the staff was very accomodating and assured our rooms were together. We overlooked the harbor and had an excellent view of the midnight fireworks. Cribs (not a portable pack n-play) were provided with a convenience pack of travel wipes, a couple of diapers, lotion and shampoo (nice touch). Doormen are very personable and accomodating. The food at Sensing was great (brunch). Now the bad...one of our family members had a double lung transplant and we were celebrating his life and our ability to ring in 2010 together. We had a group of younger women in the room next to us smoking (yes, the entire hotel is non-smoking, but some people care only about themselves--they even had a balcony in the harbor suite they were staying in). When we smelled smoke the first time, we called the front desk. Response was that they were addressing it with the occupants and if they received additional complaints, they would move the offenders. I know that was not the only complaint. We'll this continued throughout the wee hours of the morning (when you don't want to move your own room) and each time hotel staff addressed with the offenders, but never moved the group as promised. A sleepless night was the least of our concerns-- we were mainly concerned with the damage to our family member's lungs. Attempted to address our issues at checkout the next morning and staff basically said "too bad, so sad." All other Fairmont staff were more than accomodating and top notch. All I can say is move your room as soon as you think you have a problem floormate to avoid the issues we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nexusdive
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont while touring Boston before a family wedding on the Cape. Pros: The rooms are fantastic, and have a monster bathroom with marble floors, glass shower, and neat pass-thru design on the closets (opens into the room and into the bathroom). Bed was very comfy, and the room was well equipped with tech. Free wifi if you register for their Presidents? club. Cons: the only con was that they were at the top of the north end and a bit of a hike to the subway. We didn't really try any of the hotel amenities, we were simply looking for a nice place to sleep in the North End, spending most of our time out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travellover006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel approximately 2 weeks ago and absolutely loved it. The decor is outstanding and the staff is very friendly and knowledgable. My children absolutely loved the location close to the water. I rented a car at the airport and had trouble finding the hotel. I recommend the water taxi that I found out about later... much easier! The front desk was great with directions, but after explaining that I had gotten lost, they offered me the use of a complimentary GPS to help me get around town! What a life saver! I recommend this hotel. It is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Definately worth staying at ....”
Reviews.Author: le-sheriff
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4No x pleasant nights at the Battery Wharf. Cant imagine that there are many better hotels to stay in within the city. Location isnt too bad, Little Italy is only a short walk away and the rest of the city centre is reachable within 15 - 20 mins on foot. The restaurant will soon be well known, standard is very high though its setting belies its quality. Almost feels as if the establishment is in the financial district or something. The staff are the best I have ever come across, couldnt do enough to help. Rooms are lovely, good size and the bathrooms are of a very good standard. Big thumbs up and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelsavant
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2009 & had a lovely king room, water view. Room was great with all expected 4-5* hotel amenities. Loved the location: easy ealking distance to North side restaurants & historical sites. Would strongly recommend for both business & lesiure travelers. President's Club member so free WIFI. Have stayed in a lot of Boston hotels & this is my new favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in the North End”
Reviews.Author: Denver007Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night, during an overnight layover in Boston. We loved being able to take the water taxi from the airport. Comfortable beds, beautiful bathrooms, and friendly staff. The hotel's close proximity to the North End was an added bonus. I agree with other reviewers that the setup is a little different than most Fairmonts, but that did not take anything away from our experience. We definitely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: UWHusky
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of Fairmont Hotels. Battery Wharf is a fairly new hotel built on a pier in Boston's North End Boston on the water. Location is nice if you want to walk the North End of Boston which is a lot of fun. It is a nice property but a bit confusing. Two buildings. Lobby/bar/dining/reception in one and have to go outside to get to the other building where at least half of the rooms are located. I think this would not be very appealing in Boston winter! The rooms are a bit eclectic. First room I was given was ground floor looking out onto a pedestrian path. No privacy as folks taking a stroll could look into your room so. Also, the room was tiny. No desk to work on a laptop. Bedside tables were two little metal boxes on the floor...just wierd design choice. I asked to be switched to a different room on an upper floor and was accomodated. This room was much roomier with a desk. It was a very nice room in tune with my expectations for the hotel when I booked a room. I may stay again but I would be very specific about rooms. So-so fitness facility in a converted hotel room. Not what you'd expect for luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1spout
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I loved this hotel......Do not have one bad thing to say about this place!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, not so good service”
Reviews.Author: asturias2905
Reviews.Content: We stayed at thsi hotel for a weekend getaway on September. It was not was we expected. teh hotel was very nice, but the service was not was it was expected. We took the water taxi and noone helped us when we arrived to the hotel. the hotel put us in a handicapped room and they changed us 20 minutes to the closest room to the front desk, extremely noise. I had to ask 3 times the front desk lady to see the manager. it took them another 45 minutes to get us another room. We will not come back to this hotel. We have also stayed at the Lenox and it was a lot better

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: NashuaNH
Reviews.Content: We pricelined 4 star hotels for a quick overnight trip and got the Fairmont for $125. I looked on their website and rooms started at $400/night. We could never have afforded the $400, so I am extremely happy we were able to stay here. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, the setup is a little different, 4 individual buildings separated by a driveway/courtyard. The hotel has upscale furnishings, beautiful bath with rain showerhead and robes. We asked for a change of room when we got there because we noticed a cleaning problem in the bathroom. The staff immediately switched us to another room, walked to the new room with us and made sure every inch was clean and then took a picture of our complaint in the first room. They took this very seriously and Ive never been treated so well, impressive. We had a drink at the bar and they have the best veg chips (made right there) I have ever eaten. The ambiance was beautiful This hotel is a block from the North End and all the Italian restaurants. There are no close T stops, so be prepared to walk alittle or get a cab. Boston is a walking city anyway I would go back to this hotel any time --- it was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on Boston's Harbor”
Reviews.Author: MactheCop
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont on Battery Wharf is a very new hotel on Boston's harbor. My wife and I were on our 25th wedding anniversary trip and took the water taxi from Logan Airport directly to the hotels dock. The service at the hotel was excellent, although I was a little confused when the desk clerk and not a bellhop took us and our bags to our room. I had never experienced that before. Also the clerks seemed to be trying to sell one of the trolley tours, which we passed on, but everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is split into four buildings, all on Battery Wharf, one block from Boston's North End and about 3 short blocks from Paul Revere Mall and Old North Church. The rooms are modern, roomy and luxurious. There was a telephone and a speaker for the TV in the bathroom. The closet opens into the room and also into the bathroom. I think this is the largest bathroom I have experienced in a hotel. We loved our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: AppleEdmonton
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were outstanding. Very spacious, great decor and to top it off a Nespresso coffee maker in the room! Enjoyed the brunch in Sensings restaurant. The fruit plate was the most varied and delicous i've ever had. Wonderful location on the water and fanatastic service. . Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Wonderful New Hotel on the Water”
Reviews.Author: FloridaFunAdventurer
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this wonderful new hotel. It is modern and extremely comfortable - with a wonderful bath. The people were truly outstanding. The hotel is right on the water and within walking distance to wonderful restaurants and all of the historic "Freedom Trail" experience. Parking was $40 from the hotel, but off-site parking was within 2 blocks for $18. As a President Member (which I joined), we got free Internet. We were also provided with a refridgerator. We would definitely go back again! The only minor issue was a problem getting Taxis to the hotel, but we have no doubt that it will be resolved as this new hotel becomes better known.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Battery Wharf is a wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: janine007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont last month for a few nights and were absolutely thrilled that we had chosen this hotel. It is decorated beautifully, the rooms are fabulous with every comfort and modern amenity, including an espresso machine. The hotel is directly on the waterfront with a walking path/pier surrounding the place. The service at the hotel is beyond anything you've ever experienced - i tried a game of beating the doorman to the door, departing or arriving, but never succeeded. It is such a lovely spot away from all of the hustle/bustle of the city - yet walking distance to North End and Haymarket. I can't wait to go back to this hotel. 5 plus plus stars.....

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Boston Hotel Property - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: hockeytraveler1
Reviews.Content: As someone who has built many hotels, this waterfront property is outstanding, with only a couple of caveats. You simply cannot beat the location - within Boston's historic north end. The grounds, landscaping, lighting around the building and walkways along Battery Wharf are spectacular. The fit, finish and furnishings inside the hotel and guest rooms are second to none - beautiful wood, granite and tile abound. The entire staff is second to none. From the moment we checked-in to the moment we left, we were completely pampered. Valet's unloaded and parked car, front desk manager brought us and our bags to our room and gave us a brief run-down of how things work, concierge pulled strings and got us a reservation at a great nearby Italian restaurant - service, service, service! Even forgot a couple of things in the car - asked the 1st staffer we saw for help - he brought us underground, moved another vehicle to get mine off a lift - and did it with a smile. Parking was around $40/day and was added to the tab - by Boston standards, the room and parking charges were very fair for what you got. Only other critical points would be that our king had a shower only - it was a beautiful shower, but no place to soak - this was surprising for such a high-end property, but they did tell me in advance when I made reservations. We were on the first floor and near some hallway exit doors and could hear them opening and closing all night - easy solution - put them on magnetic hold-opens and tie them into the fire alarm system! Also not sure what type of wall construction was used between guest rooms or how much insulation was in said walls, but they could have been built a little quieter - not the worst I've heard, but not the best either. All in all, a magnificent jewel in Boston and you just can't get closer to the North End.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: Spytha
Reviews.Content: Recently flew to Boston on business and had the opportunity to stay at the a new property from the Fairmont - Battery Wharf. Everything was exceptional, from the property itself, the amenities, new restaurant and service but even more impressive was the staff. There was a feeling that they all enjoyed being there and where at the ready to make your stay as comfortable and hospitable as possible. I would definitely return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a visit to Boston”
Reviews.Author: LesleyWEngland
Reviews.Content: We liked the postion of the Fairmont Battery Wharf - right by the water and just at the end of the main street in the Italian North End District. We were pleased with our room - large, light and with all the right stuff in it, and with the helpfulness of the staff when we had a problem. It's a very new place and there is a sense of it still getting 'worn in' - but it was fine for us. Only drawback was the extortionate price of breakfast - why don't hotels like this do a 'tourist' one as well as one for those on expense accounts?

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, food, view, rooms...this place has it all!”
Reviews.Author: vailwildflower
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our honeymoon, what better way to start it off then a water taxi ride across from the airport to our hotel where we were met with a staff that had the ultimate goal of making sure we had the most fabulous stay ever! We were surprised with a bottle of champagne, complimentary of course, and a great view from our room. We stayed in the Fairmont Gold building, Sarah Josepha Hale building, and were treated like royalty from the moment we walked through the doors. We are not used to this sort of treatment, so we were wowed from minute one. The breakfast, appetizer and dessert/cocktail hours served the most amazing food; very high class and delicious! My favorite was the boston cream pie with an espressotini the night of our arrival before heading out to little Italy to check out the nightlife. I cannot give enough kudos to the staff at the Fairmont Battery Wharf, Gold! It was a more expensive stay for us than normal, but we would save up and to it all over again in a heartbeat as it was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Super service, but poor sound insulation!”
Reviews.Author: Springerhog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Battery Wharf for three days before our 7-day New England / Canadian cruise aboard Royal Caribbean International's Jewel of the Seas. When we returned from our cruise, we stayed one additional night before heading back home. First of all, the service at the Fairmont was top notch, truly five-star quality. The rooms were very nicely furnished and modern with great views of the harbor. The location very convenient and very close to "Little Italy," which has over 100+ great Italian restaurants. Tons of history to see near the hotel, including the "Freedom Trail." I also loved its close proximity to the water, which offered a great location for peaceful walks on the boardwalk. My only complaint with the hotel was poor sound insulation. We could clearly hear people in the adjoining rooms through the walls. The doors to the rooms were exceptionally poor. It seemed that every voice or door closing/opening could be clearly heard from the hallway. Other than that, I would still stay at the Fairmont on our next visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: glennjam
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend this hotel to everyone, it was so beautiful. Our King Suite was extra nice, the rainfall shower is awesome. Everyone is so kind and helpful. The bed is sooooo comfortable. Beauty awaits you here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!! Would highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Left_on_a_jet_plane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Fairmont and had a great time! The room was spectacular, the bed extremely comfy and we had an excellent view of the water! The staff at the front desk where extremely helpful in helping us get around town and suggest great restaurants. They were always very friendly and helpful. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Gold Service!”
Reviews.Author: gabbygrrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night at this 'new' property. I usually stay at Fairmont hotels so I was excited to have a fresh hotel choice when in Boston. The Fairmont Copley is wonderful and perfectly situated in the center of the action, but having an option for being down by the waterfront/Back Bay area, away from the busy streets is a nice alternative. We were able to stroll around the wharf at night. It was beautiful! We stayed in a Gold Level room, which in this case, is actually a seperate building! It has a dedicated Lounge with the usual Gold Level foods/beverages/etc. The room was oversized, NYC slick style, with LCD touch pad phone, rain shower, a bed that you never want to get out of, and a wonderful recliner chair with large flat screen TV. A DVD library was available for our use and we snuggled in for a movie with some snacks in the comfort of our room. Another bonus of the Gold Service is the use of the hotel car for drop-off only. We used it to get where we needed to go each time, and then worked out way back. I am not sure why other reviews were so negative. Yes, it's a new hotel and it usually takes 1-2 years for things to 'settle'. As a traveler, you are supposed to expect that things will need to be worked out and you will not get a perfect stay if you visit within that time period. Our negatives: when our taxi dropped us at the Gold Building, the doorman told us we had to walk over to the other building to check in-that is not correct. Also we had requested coffee to be delivered with our wake up call )available to Gold Level only). Our call came right on time, but the coffee came 40 minutes later-we actually passed the room service cart on our way down to the Lounge for breakfast. Great hotel, relaxing location, wonderful services and amenities. I would go back again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but some teething problems”
Reviews.Author: ASWh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Battery Wharf in Boston at the end of our trip. The hotel seemed to be a little further away from the centre of Boston than we thought. We arrived just after 3pm and it took over 40 mins to get checked in and taken to the room. We'd driven for 5 hours and had to return the rental car by 4pm so that made things a little stressful. Other people were coming in and being shown to their rooms ahead of us so I'm not sure if it was just that the person on the desk was new, but it was not a great start. I was under the impression from the website that all rooms had a harbour view but the room we were shown to had a view of the valet parking. When we got back to the hotel, we went back to the front desk to ask if there was another room available. For a reasonable cost increase, we were offered a significantly improved room (a suite in fact) on the same floor with a fantastic view. We greatly enjoyed this room but there were still some problems getting the internet up and running as the transfer from our original room didn't seem to be done properly. We couldn't access the internet which was something of a problem as I needed to check in for a flight the following day. That said, the front desk sorted out a laptop that I used to get checked in and the internet was fixed the day after. The hotel is very well appointed and the rooms are very nice, although not much wardrobe space, even in the suite. We enjoyed the upgrade and would recommend the hotel but I would hope the teething problems will get sorted as Fairmont is a high end chain and you wouldn't expect these things still to be going wrong (the hotel opened at the beginning of the year). All in all a good experience, but the issues detracted from the last day of our trip which was a bit of a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MAXINEOxford
Reviews.Content: This hotel opened in 2008. The staff are outstanding, the rooms are excellent and its position on the harbour front is superb. The breakfast buffet will set you up for the day and their coffee is hot and fresh! The bar food was good and not expensive considering it is a 5 star hotel. Boston is a beautiful city and is very easy to walk around. There is always something to watch on the harbour front. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the nearest T station (Aquarium) and this is just 2 stops from the airport - 2 dollars. The hotel is also approx 10 mins from Quincey market and 5 mins from the city trolley tour bus stop. I cannot think of anything negative to say about Fairmont Battery Wharf. I am so glad that we picked it for our Boston holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: SerenTravels
Reviews.Content: The staff is so accommodating and nice. The rooms are beautiful and very comfortable and modern. Beautiful view and easy walking to many restaurants and attractions, close to the Logan airport. Cannot wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Most modern and comfortable hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: MatureGourmet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spectacular in its appointments and decor: all modern and spotless as well as comfortable beds and wonderful, large baths. Room have water views and the French restaurant with Chef Martin is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Enjoying Boston”
Reviews.Author: Yami
Reviews.Content: Ten Reasons To Stay at the Fairmont Battery Wharf: 1. You can take the water taxi from the airport and get a wonderful water view of Boston as you approach the hotel. 2. Extra long/large soak tub in bathroom, lets you soak your aches and pains away after a day walking to and from the sights of Boston. 3. Right at the North End, perfect location for Italian food lovers. 4. Beautiful interior design gives your stay a feeling of elegance. 5. Attentive staff responds quickly to any problem. 6. Beautiful harbor views out window. 7. Easy walk to New England Aquarium and Faneuil Hall. 8. Very modern amenities, key cards that you don't swipe, but just hold up to reader. 9. Friendly door men. 10. Free wireless Internet if you join the Fairmont frequent stayers club. I suffer from early morning insomnia, and one early morning I was walking into the lobby just as an employee was about to vacuum. Not only did he put his vacuum away so as not to disturb me, but he also brought me a nice carafe of coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, neighboorhood, and city”
Reviews.Author: TravelgirlLouisiana
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Labor Day weekend. We liked the hotel overall. It's of course relatively new, so there were a lot of nice features like 42 inch. LCD television, rainshower features in glass enclosed stall, etc. We really liked the neighborhood, though would probably consider staying in the Back Bay area if traveling to Boston during colder months as that neighborhood would be more central. The key to the North End is the proximity to the water and charm of all of the Italian restaurants on Hanover Street. Definitely agree with the comments made by previous reviewers regarding some apparent inexperience on the part of the front desk staff and valet personnel. It's not that some of them were downright rude, it was that there were a lot of twenty-something year old male employees who seemed more interested in chatting and joking with one another than acknowledging or warmly addressing the guests. I think they would be well served to hire some more experienced employees to man the front desk. There are no pool or spa facilities at this hotel. Very strange as the spa is one of the highest revenue part of a hotel. An employee said that a spa is in the works, though I saw no sign of such. Boston recommendations: Freedom Trail walk through Freedom Trail Foundation, explore Beacon Hill brownstone lined streets, and try Stregu and Sensing restaurants, the latter being in the hotel. While Sensing at first blush seems very expensive and not very timely for its luxurious menu in these times of economic uncertainty, you can go there just for dessert (try the pistachio macaroon) or have a burger. It doesn't have to cost you $300 if you plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and views!!”
Reviews.Author: biggie76Toronto
Reviews.Content: overall, great hotel, awesome room, bed is great and comfy....washrooms are very unique and clean. Good size, great view of the harbour....pay for the view, it's worth it! only issue is the walk to the T station, you're a lil' bit out but still close....quieter part of town....higher recommend staying here if the price is right!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: chrisb1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and found the hotel in keeping with a Fairmont - good service, nice atmosphere. The room was very comfortable, with a big TV, nice bathroom, big bed and good linens. The housekeeping staff was not very attentive (forgot to refill milks, tookaway shower cap without replacing it). Try to get a room on the second floor, as the first floor does not feel very private, with the seawall just outside the window. Fairmont offers free HighSpeed, but only to members of their (free) President's Club The North End is, in my opinion, the best place to stay in Boston. Lots of street scenes, great restaurants, beautiful water views. It is only 10 minutes to downtown and the Metro, so that is not bad. Unfortunately you are stuck with the expensive hotel parking, but that seems to be the case throughout Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with lots of potential. Food & mini-bar prices (very) high!”
Reviews.Author: anoushli
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel at a discounted rate (USD 170 incl. tax). For that price, this was a perfect hotel for us. For the published price on the website, this hotel is overpriced. A bit ouside of the hecticness, the hotel is very new and clean. It can be reached on foot from downtown as Boston is pretty small and we walked to most places, but if you are dependant on public transport to get around, a more central hotel may be better - The nearest "T" train station is a ten minute fast walk away. On the plus side, the room and the bathroom area were spacious, and the bed & pillows were really comfortable. We had a harbour view, which was great, but many rooms face adjacent buildings. We found our room very quiet and the staff were helpful. As some other reviewers have said, many of the staff seem young and quite inexperienced- many looked like college kids in an oversized uniform. The hotel comprises of several buildings and the gym, although it is open 24h is in a separate building next door. All in all, for the discounted price, we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Decor, Good Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Sungirlxxxx
Reviews.Content: After a less than pleasant stay at Copley Square, I was not keen to stay at another Fairmont, however I was a guest of someone who booked this hotel so I did not wish to seem rude. Hotel is newer so rooms are are in a better condition.Well appointed bathroom as well. Staff were pleasant . Hotel is good for access to Faneuil/Quincy and North End. We ate all meals out , so cannot comment on food. Not too far a walk to get to Mikes for pastry or to Pizzeria Regina. Rate was actually quite cheap especially when comparing it to the poor experience we had in Marthas Vineyard which was more for motel type of accomodation. I absolutely do recommend this as an option in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “quite impressive!”
Reviews.Author: alexusshoes
Reviews.Content: I travel to hotels about 14x a month, and knowing that my assistant booked me at a Fairmont property, My expectations were set to be high upon checking in... When I arrived by water taxi there was a front desk agent there to assist me with luggage and bring me to the front desk. This is were I met another agent named Daniel. (be sure to ask for him if you visit this hotel) He was one of the youngest but most informative and helpful rep. I have ever encountered throughout my traveling lifestyle. He noticed I was paying with my American Express Platinum card and began talking about all of the Perks and benefits the card has and how I can use it for other Fairmont property's. (Theirs a lot of travel benefits i didn't even know about) After being checked In, he escorted me to my room. I was in a different building from where the lobby was located (liked it better than I thought I would) Room #138. He took his time and showed me all of the features to the room, which made me feel that much more at home. Explaining everything from how to turn on the AC to how to disable my own doorbell (hehe) The room itself was just lovely, everything was clean, modern but incorporating a true warm feeling to the room. HOWEVER there was one major problem with my room..... The carpet was soaked after I took a shower. I called the front desk and a lady informed me that she was aware of the problem, which was confusing why they would check people into this room with that knowledge? I had a fantastic lunch at there Asian restaurant called Sensing. Daniel saw me in the restaurant and stopped by to check in on me, and how my stay was. I told him how much I loved the new Hotel however I was disliking my soaked carpet..... He told me not to worry about! He moved me to a different room on the second floor, moved my luggage for me and on top of that, he even included a continental breakfast for me the morning of my flight, all while I was still sitting down with my colleagues eating lunch. Overall I was extremely impressed by all of the Front Desk agents assistance, they were great in the morning getting me all of my directions, and made my check out a quick, thorough and prompt transaction. I would highly recommend this hotel to any families or business travelers who will be in the Financial district. P.s. As I said before, my expectations were set high and I would say 95% of the time, they were meeting if not exceeding it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Would Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: ZigZag5
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel - Very modern and trendy. Located in a nice, quiet part of town (north end), overlooking the water. The locations is very convenient to attractions (less than 10 minute walk to Faneuil/ Quincy Mrkt). Excellent Service and the view from the rooms are amazing. The rooms were well appointed and the bed very comfortable. Taking the water taxi from Logan airport is a nice alternative to taking a cab as the water taxi takes you right to the hotel. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: TravelerJim3
Reviews.Content: By far this hotel outranks every hotel in Boston. Every aspect of my stay was perfect. I will be back! From the moment I arrived at the Fairmont Battery Wharf I was blown away at the hotel, the location, and the staff. Everything was wonderful. We will see this hotel listed among the top tier in the country. Can't wait to go back!

HotelInfo.Name: Fairmont Battery Wharf
HotelInfo.Address: 3 Battery Wharf, Boston, MA 02109
